reviews.text: I love this place! Amazing atmosphere, decoration, a lot of interesting details. Have one if the best location. You can stay on terassa and enjoy view of Plaza Oriente or seat inside and be in special atmosphere. All staff are very kind and nice! Have good choice of breakfast, deserts, have good menu. Almost all breakfast served with French fries. Hardly recommend to visit ☕

The staff doesn't speak English although this is in a touristic area. The food is quite expensive, but not very good. We were here with a group of five. The meat was partly raw. I mean raw, not undercooked. It was even still cold. The so called scrambled eggs were not eatable. My colleague returned them after one bite. The only reason for two stars is that the restaurant looks really nice and they play a nice selection of music.

Great location near the Palace, but keep in mind that you can only get the cheaper prix fixe menu if you sit inside.

Restaurant has an old world charm with a good number of locals.  

Food was pretty good...3 course lunch with drink and bread included was 11 Euros per person.

This restaurant has amazing views of the palace. Service appauling. Had to ask for milk with English tea. Dessert came with no crust. Had to ask for forks to eat it with. I've had afternoon tea many times here and introduced many friends. It's not enjoyable anymore.

Disappointed to say the least ... service was just terrible ... took ages and it was rather unpleasant. Food... was average... not a place I would go back to. Maybe it's better in summer when you sit outside. It is also rather pricey.... breakfast for two costs around €30. Nice interior decor but that's the only positive I could say about this place.

reviews.text: Excellent time sitting at the bar and chatting it up with the bartender who spoke very good English.  His knowledge of wine were great as were the recommendations.  Would highly recommend this place to anyone traveling by!

We had 4 dishes and all were more than fantastic! Very nice and friendly service. Wanted to come back a few days later but it was completely full - remember to book well in advance especially on weekends.

Amazing cocktails, lounge feel. They map the flavor profile of each drink (intensity, citrus, umami, sweet, etc.) and have a ton of combinations. Also marked which can be alcohol-free, and give popcorn with every drink!

Wonderful place! The meat (I didn't remember a dish) and the cheese plate were sooo delicious! Extra stars for your stuff: guys on a bar were so nice: offered a very tasty drinks and answered on all my questions! Thank you for a delightful time!
Great place for dinner in Madrid. Very good ambience, Good selection of wines and also has a few Vegetarian options...

reviews.text: We had an amazing evening! Service was amable and relatively quick for how extremely busy it was! Food was to die for! Tapas sized portions, so we shared some things, and quality was 10/10 😍 terrace was cute right next to a busy street so loads to see! We will be back! Hasta luego!

reviews.text: Los dueños, Nacho y Raquel, fueron muy amables y atentos. La casa está muy cuidada. Tiene una zona común con futbolín gratuito y diversos juegos. Además, en la terraza hay un porche y piscina para el verano. El pueblo es genial para una escapada de unos días, ideal para desconectar en pareja. El spa es acogedor y precioso con detalle de infusión por parte de los dueños, también desayuno agradable con bastante variedad. La habitación amplia. Te dan mucha intimidad, nos sentimos como en casa.

Hemos estado dos días y todo muy bien. La atención muy buena. La habitación muy limpia. La casa con todos los servicios que puedas necesitar. El spa genial. Ideal para salir de la rutina y poder relajarte unos días. Lo recomiendo.
Lugar encantador y una atención estupenda!! Me sentí como en casa !! Ideal para desconectar de tu rutina diaria 🧖🏻‍♀️❤️

adr_address: Calle Mayor, 9, 19197 Rebollosa de Hita, Guadalajara, Spain

reviews.text: Es un lugar con unas vistas increíbles, el apartamento está genial, la dueña es muy atenta y nos dejó unos dulces para desayunar. Lo recomiendo 100%.
Alojamiento muy cómodo y con todo lo necesario  para una estancia tranquila. La anfitriona Mila es muy amable y atenta. Recomendable.

Es un conjunto de casas, como un caserío dividido, nosotros nos alojamos en la más pequeña. Un apartamento para dos con opción a cama supletoria. La casa tenía de todo, la más equipada en la que estado, de todo para la cocina, toallas en buena cantidad, secador de pelo, sofá cómodo (aunque pequeñín como el apartamento) y detalles como leche, café, rosquillas fritas, DVD con pelis... Las camas eran cómodas y suficienteme amplias (mi marido cabía entero, que mide 1,90 y en algunos sitios se le salen los pies). El entorno es muy tranquilo, una aldea con poquitos casas y mucha naturaleza alrededor. Está a 20 minutos de Guadalajara, y otro punto a su favor (al menos para nosotros) es que admiten mascotas. Lo que menos me gustó fue que en esa casa había olor como a embutido y que las únicas ventanas que había daban al patio interior(aunque es bonito también). La muchacha que nos recibió muy amable y simpática. Así que en general una experiencia positiva
Espectacular gente de este sitio tan peculiar
Preciosa vista de la Alcarria

reviews.text: We spent one night at the pension, before an early flight from Madrid. The owners were very nice, prepared the room for us, and despite a lack of a common language, managed to communicate everything that was needed. Even though our room faced the highway, it was quiet enough to sleep well. However, you should request a room facing the other side of you're a light sleeper. The bathroom was a bit damp, but the shower was warm and pleasant. It's really good quality for the price (38€). The village is fairly cute, with a breathtaking view over the valley.
Ok

reviews.text: Una casa limpia y acogedora con todo lujo de detalles

Casa spaziosissima, con una vista incantevole sulla mancha.
La casa ad oggi (gennaio 2018) presenta tre camere doppie con bagno, una camerata con bagno due saloni molto spaziosi e una cucina. Ma il padrone ci ha parlato di lavori di ampliamento con altre camere e piscina.
Prezzo veramente competitivo se siete alla ricerca di una "casa rural" per piccoli gruppi.
Il padrone è disponibilissimo e gentilissimo e si vede che ci tiene veramente alla sua casa!
No conozco la casa rural. Voy a un domicilio particular.

Una casa ideal y bien preparada para grupos familiares con bastantes sillas y mesas para alojarse en el interior y también mesas y sillas para el exterior. Barbacoa aperos para realizar paellas con bombona de butano plancha también a gas, bastante menaje y numerosos cuartos de baño para cada habitación. Varios salones con 3 TVs, limpio y un dueño muy amable y atento. Además a unos cuantos metros dispone de otra vivienda por si el número de personas que acuden aumenta poder distribuir en dos grupos.

reviews.text: Nos hemos alojado 3 noches y ha sido una escapada de desconexión. Permite mascotas, con total comodidad para ellas, detalle digno de agradecimiento. El trato inigualable por parte de la propietaria que en todo momento estaba disponible. La casa un encanto, con un montón de detalles que la hacían especial, preciosa. Alternativas de juegos y películas en caso de que el día se tuerza por el tiempo. Por ponerle alguna pega la falta de espacio exterior, pero tiene la opción de barbacoa ya que cuenta un un patio en la parte trasera de la casa, lo cual solventa dicho problema. Totalmente recomendable. Gracias!!!

Renovated room, an up to date bathroom.
Talking to other guests we hear the same views.
Restaurant fair to good and the menu and prices in-line with one can expect.
Never ever tasted calamaris like here.
A salad a joy for the eyes and one's palate.

Then paying a room price euros 52.
Compared to the euros 43 we paid in F1 the night before in France Tours - the first was

A nice selection of old type writers

Thank you MAVI for this treatment.

This is the first time we have had something to eat here and are glad that we stopped. We both had filete de ternera and it was yummy, plus the chips were better than the skinny ones or triple-fried ones we get at many establishments in England. Recommended.

plus_code.compound_code: R66J+G9 Miraflores de la Sierra, Spain

reviews.text: We were looking for a place to stay end of May, beginning of June and to our surprise every hotel was closed, from Rascafria to Miraflores de la Sierra. So we were happy to find the Miraflores hotel, a nice clean place with big rooms with a terrace. Everything worked out fine. You can  make nice walks in the environment. My advice: call first before you go.

We reserved rooms 1 month in advance and upon arrival the hotel was closed! We and 6 other groups (with small children) were waiting outside the hotel for 2 hours, there was no note etc to indicate the hotel was closed. We had to call the Guardia Civil and eventually an employee was located who informed us the hotel was closed due to issue with heating! No call to inform customers, no offer of alternative accomodation, no apologies!!. We were refused the possibility of talking with hotel management, and we requested they call us to explain the situation. 3 week later and still no call. We managed to find alternative accomodation in El Palacio, at double the price!. 
Later during the day some locals in the village informed us that hotel was well known for financial problems.
Disgraceful behaviour from hotel, completely unprofessional. We have made a complaint with the police so that others may not suffer the same fate.
It is perfect
Beautiful place

Un desacierto arquitectónico perpetrado contra el pueblo. Tan indigno mamotreto de hormigón a la entrada de un pueblo como Miraflores debería estar prohibido. Una pena que el pueblo y sus políticos permitieran su construcción en su día.

vicinity: Calle del Río, s/n, Miraflores de la Sierra

reviews.text: Un gustazo, cuidado en todo detalle, cómodo, buena cama, buena ducha... ¡Bueno diría que todo! Estuvimos dos noches y me habría gustado estar un par de noches más. Además para visitar Miraflores es perfecto. En la entrada también se ofrece mucha información sobre actividades posibles en la zona.
Pueblo encantador donde se puede comer bien
Perfecto. Personal muy amable, todo muy limpio. Habitaciones que dan gusto ir, muy bien equipadas. Y muy romántico; mi pareja y yo lo pasamos en grande.
En pleno centro de Miraflores, los apartamentos están genial: bien decorados, espaciosos y limpios. Una pena que esté tan cerca de la iglesia: las campanadas te despiertan.

Si te tocan unos vecinos ruidosos, las paredes son de papel y se escucha todo, esta al lado de la iglesia y cuando suenan las campañas parece que estás dentro de la iglesia, no puedes hablar en ese momento porque no se escucha.
El apartamento bonito, acogedor.
La atención es lo mejor, son muy majos.

reviews.text: Clean and well located

La ubicación es muy buena, en el centro del pueblo.La habitación no se parecía en nada a la de las fotos, era más pequeña y fea, muy ruidosa porque se oía a los de las habitaciones de al lado,un niño llorón y el ruido de la calle, por lo que no pudimos descansar mucho.
La colcha y cojines estaban sucios, la ropa de cama muy antigua, la almohada muy baja, el cabecero de la cama se movía y el agua caliente del lavabo salía de color marrón. 

El desayuno estaba bien pero algo escaso. Se echa de menos algo de bollería además del pan tostado, pero muy acertado el zumo de naranja.

El restaurante demasiado caro y los postres además de escasos, dejan mucho que desear con respecto a calidad y presentación.

Tiene cosas mejorables en cuanto a la limpieza y mantenimiento de la habitación, pero en general está bastante bien.

Enhorabuena María!! , nos habéis  enamorado con vuestro trato amable  y el excelente servicio de José, que atiende a todos con su mejor sonrisa aunque esté repleto el local , un 10 por la exquisitez de vuestros platos y el cariño que dispensais a vuestros clientes. 
Volveremos sí o sí,  sería un error imperdonable no hacerlo. 
 Un millón de gracias!!

Hemos estado en Semana Santa. Sitio acogedor y tranquilo; ideal para desconectar. Situado en el centro del pueblo. Desayuno incluido en el que te sirven un poco de todo ( no es buffet). 
100% recomendable si buscas tranquilidad

Estuvimos en Semana Santa mi familia y yo y estamos encantados.
El hotel muy tranquilo, situado en una zona céntrica desde la cual se puede hacer varias rutas por la montaña. La habitación (cuádruple) era muy amplia, la limpieza correcta, la decoración con mucho gusto, si he de poner una queja, sería el sillón de la salita, un poco viejo e incómodo. La comida buenísima y con variedad , los postres a cual mejor, y todos caseros. Pero sobre todo lo mejor que tiene es su personal, desde el primero hasta el último, sobre todo José, que con su trato y su sonrisa permanente nos hizo sentir como en casa. Sin duda alguna repetiremos. Gracias!!!

vicinity: Paseo de los Álamos, 6, Miraflores de la Sierra

Qué falta de profesionalidad.

Experiencia muy agradable por el trato como el servicio, tanto la cocina como los productos son excelentes y volveremos a repetir seguro. Muy recomendable 🙌🏻

reviews.text: Un lugar con encanto en plena sierra madrileña en contacto con la naturaleza,paraje lleno de tranquilidad,atención exquisita.
Fin de semana increíble!! La acogida y el servicio magnífico.

Hemos estado en un evento privado por lo que no puedo valorar el servicio, solo las instalaciones. El sitio es perfecto para acampadas, convivencias. Vistas bonitas, naturaleza. Los niños disfrutan mucho del espacio. Hemos estado alojados en las cabañas y están bien. Limpio, aunque con un ramillete de setas naturales en el baño :) . Los colchones un pelin blandos, pero hemos descansado. Lo peor... Las cuestas, aunque depende para quien, esto no tiene por qué ser negativo. El precio de la habitación de 10 camas ha sido 14 euros por persona y noche. Los niños a partir de 4 años pagan.
Estupenda instalación del Grupo El Colladito. Muy recomendable.

Una amiga celebro su boda allí. Hay diferentes tipos de alojamiento, habitaciones compartidas (albergue), individuales (casa rural y cabañas). Es un lugar fantástico para descansar y desconectar, además tiene piscina, merenderos, y un personal encantador.

reviews.text: Safe camping with all facilities you need. People very friendly and affordable prices. We stayed in a  bungalow with one room and equipped with toilet and shower, small kitchen and furniture. The area is very pleasant too. Highly recommended!

Pleasant site with lovely views of the mountains.  Very quiet as it is December so no amenities open.  Supermarket in town 10 minutes walk away and local hotel cafe about five minute walk.  Toilets and showers old, basic but clean enough with hot water.  Lights on the dreaded timer so don't be tempted to linger on the loo.
Pitches disgraceful. Completely unkempt touring area. Focus is on chalets only. Toilets and showers clean but dated. Only upside was access only 2km from motorway.
Nice site but make sure you are stocked up 9€ for a cheap bottle of white wine that you would not pay 2€ for out shop
Convenient stop over travelling back to UK. Showers and toilets clean but dated. Pitches small and scruffy and ours had dog mess on it.

formatted_address: Calle de Fabián Lorente, 16, 28792 Miraflores de la Sierra, Madrid, Spain

plus_code.compound_code: R67J+C2 Miraflores de la Sierra, Spain

reviews.text:
Excepcional trato en este alojamiento, limpieza exquisita, ubicación perfecta, la casa cuenta con todas las comodidades, muy buena calefacción, decoración y mobiliario moderno con un toque rústico acompañado hasta con muebles de anticuario, todo cuidado con mucho mimo.
La dueña encantadora y dispuesta a ayudarte e informarte de todo lo necesario en cuanto a la zona, los servicios...habla varios idiomas.
No puedo dejar pasar la recomendación del Restaurante Asador La Fuente en el casco histórico, de la misma propiedad, donde puedes degustar espectaculares Asados, Pescados...riquísimos Postres caseros todo ello acompañado de un inmejorable servicio.
Sin duda repetiría en este alojamiento, todo fantástico.
5 Estrellas.
Recomiendo 100% muy buena
Está muy chulo

Una estafa. Cobran precio de 4 o 5 estrellas por un establecimiento deficiente. Suciedad, sábanas roídas, toallas viejas, insectos en la cama, y ni una pastilla de jabón. Propietaria mejor que se dedique a otros menesteres. Nada recomendable salvo por causa de fuerza mayor (único establecimiento libre -como es lógico-).

Muy recomendable esta casa Rural en Miraflores.
Nos encontramos con la casa muy limpia,la temperatura para ser invierno,estaba ideal,CALEFACCION radiante.La atención de la dueña de la casa a nuestra llegada fue muy amable y ponía a nuestra disposición todo tipo de comodidades para que estuviéramos muy agusto.Tambien nos informó de que podríamos comer y cenar  en el Asador " La Fuente" propiedad de ellos,muy buena comida.
La casa es amplia y una decoración moderna pero a la vez integrada dentro de un pueblo de montaña,a destacar los muebles de muy buena calidad y conservación,las camas muy cómodas,los baños muy limpios.
La casa tiene en su entrada un patio cerrado con valla de piedra de pequeña-mediana altura, el entorno de la casa es muy arbolado,tiene un parque enfrente con bancos y está situada en el principio de la subida por carretera del Puerto de Canencia,a unos 400m de la plaza central del pueblo.
Recomiendo pasear tanto por el bonito pueblo,como la zona inmediata a la casa,cerca hay una fuente que la llaman la fuente del Pino,que sale un agua muy fresca y rica.
Recomendable hace una excursión al puerto de la Morcuera(1800m a 2200m)si quieres ver la nieve(7km) o al Puerto de  Canencia (1500m a 1800m) que está de la casa a 5km,las vistas a las subidas de estos puertos son un regalo para la vista.

vicinity: Calle de Fabián Lorente, 16, Miraflores de la Sierra

reviews.text: Comfortable and welcoming. Lovely bar/ restaurant adjacent.

Bonito hotel en la Cabrera, a media hora de madrid. Se llega muy bien por la A1. Muy bien habitaciones y zonas comunes. Servicio impecable, todo muy limpio, muy amables y la terraza es una maravilla. Se pueden organizar comuniones, reuniones de empresa o fines de semana en familia
Aprovechando un tiempo primaveral nos fuimos a pasar el fin de semana a La Cabrera. El hotel fenomenal, las habitaciones amplias y limpias. Muy tranquilo

Organizamos un evento para más de ochenta personas durante un fin de semana. El trato y la disposición del personal fue excelente, siempre dispuesto a colaborar para que todo saliera perfecto. Las instalaciones son acogedoras, c��modas y limpias. Muy recomendable.
Es uno de esos lugares de la sierra de Madrid donde puedes hospedarte durante un finde semana para disfrutar del encanto de la sierra Madrileña.

formatted_address: Calle San Roquillo, 2, 28729 Valdemanco, Madrid, Spain

reviews.text:
Sitio ideal para estar tranquilos, casa muy acogedora y práctica,  los colchones para mi gusto estupendos . No tengo ningún “ pero” que añadir.
Para mí de  -10-. Si puedo volveré más días.

Estuvimos pasando Nochevieja en  Casa Rural la Mimosa, y nos encantó, cumplió todos los perfiles q pido cuando salimos fuera de casa, sobretodo limpieza y comodidad. María encantadora y Gerardo muy generoso, nos dió unos huevos de sus gallinas, q estaban para chuparse los dedos. Seguro q volveremos

Estupenda casa, para 6 personas en Valdemanco. Tiene dos dormitorios dobles y esta situada toda en una planta baja, por lo que es ideal para familias con niños o personas mayores. Tiene un patio muy mono que te permite desayunar al aire libre.

La casa es estupenda. Como nueva, limpia y amplia. Tanto María cómo Gerardo nos han tratado fenomenal. Muy bonitas vistas. El pueblo (Valdemanco) es muy pequeño y tiene poco que ver, pero con el coche hemos visitado todos los pueblos de alrededores. Hemos descansado y desconectado. Un encanto de personas.

La casa está genial, espaciosa y limpia. Tiene patio, barbacoa y porche. Sin embargo su precio es muy elevado y desde mi perspectiva injustificado ya que era ubicada dentro del pueblo y no existen excesivos atractivos turísticos en él.

adr_address: La, Calle Fragua, 50, 28794 Guadalix de la Sierra, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: La, Calle Fragua, 50, 28794 Guadalix de la Sierra, Madrid, Spain
name: Casa Rural La Fragua

plus_code.compound_code: Q8P5+85 Guadalix de la Sierra, Spain

reviews.text:
La casa es enorme, los espacios están genial, estuvimos muy cómodos. El salón es muy grande con sofás buenos,  futbolín y dardos, tv grande y chimenea, a la mesa le faltan un par de sillas. Las habitaciones son amplias todas con baños muy bonitos y tv. La buhardilla es genial para una familia entera.
La cocina tiene todos los electrodomésticos necesarios, pero poco espacio de almacenaje, toda la compra la tuvimos que dejar encima de la encimera. Para lo grande que es la casa, la cocina se quedó pequeña. Faltan algunas cosas de menaje como copas de vino y un escurridor.
El olor a tubería en la planta de abajo es un poco desagradable aunque supongo que tiene difícil solución. Tb. echamos de menos un termostato en cada planta, hay mucha diferencia de temperatura entre la planta baja y la buhardilla.

vicinity: La, Calle Fragua, 50, Guadalix de la Sierra

adr_address: Plaza de San Pedro, 11 Bis, 28743 Garganta de los Montes, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza de San Pedro, 11 Bis, 28743 Garganta de los Montes, Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel QuercusTierra

plus_code.compound_code: W8C6+PM Garganta de los Montes, Spain

reviews.text:
Trato nulo, por decir algo. Pagas 150€ por una suite, que tiene servicio 24h de recepción y tiene bar. Cuando llegas te encuentras el edificio vacío y cuando llevas un rato esperando, se te ocurre llamar por teléfono y resulta que te dicen que tienes que coger las llaves de la recepción tú mismo. Qué el tiempo de desayuno es solo media hora y el supuesto "bar" nunca está abierto. Si quieres meter el coche al garaje tienes que abrirte tu mismo la puerta. En mi caso tuve que ayudar yo a los clientes para que supiesen que tenían que hacer y no les pasase lo mismo que a mí. 
Además de todo eso, el jacuzzi estaba sucio como se puede ver en las imágenes.

En resumen un precio muy elevado para un establecimiento que no tiene servicios y cobran por ellos, una decepción y tengo muy claro que no volveré.

Además no aceptan cuando haces una crítica y no les gusta, una lástima ese nulo servicio porque las instalaciones son bonitas.

No lo recomiendo y siento que he pagado un precio que no lo vale.
Todo estupendo, la habitación y el baño impecables y el restaurante precioso. El desayuno muy rico.
El hotel bien,  la comida buena aunque se va de precio. No funciona el wifi en ninguna zona del hotel. Limpieza normal. Trato correcto
Sitio fantástico, comida muy rica. La carne te la presentan antes de cocinarla. Ganadería propia. El personal agradable. Teresa encantadora.

Perfecto hotel para desconectar del ajetreo de Madrid. Apenas a 40 minutos en coche, en un pueblo con unas vistas espectaculares. Desde el restaurante del hotel se veían unas vistas de las montañas increíbles. La dueña del hotel muy atenta, nos ayudo en todo lo que necesitamos, ademas de recomendarnos sitios para cenar que estaban muy ricos. Si podéis, recomiendo las habitaciones con jacuzzi, es inmejorable.

vicinity: Plaza de San Pedro, 11 Bis, Garganta de los Montes

reviews.text: This is 4 star hotel? Maybe back in 90's! Very used rooms, lobby, non-friendly staff and lack of organisation. Never more... This is based on experience of group of more than 30 people - a company attending the exhibition at Feria Madrid.

Very modern and attractive. I felt very comfortable. There is a nice foyer where you can hold business meetings. A little bit far from the centre. It was difficult to find even by the locals. I prefer hotels in the suburbs on business trips, so for me it was perfect.
Great facilities, I really enjoyed my stay here. Even though the staff is not the best the rooms are very good and clean. The community is nice!

This hotel was horrible, cracks in ceiling, broken sink and customer service was the worst  ever.. Front counter was very rude..Its also located near a school so it is also noisy..I would never recommend this place...
Value for money comes to mind. Pretty average hotel. Not really close to anything noteworthy. Keep Uber or Cabify handy.

reviews.text: Amazing place! Rooms are clean, cozy, modern and with cool designs. Every floor makes you feel like if you were in different hotels. Only thing it is located a little far from the city center.
Really nice place to stay.  Very modern and friendly staff. Highly recommended
A great hotel and reasonably priced.Added bonus is the hotel has off street under cover parking available.Thanks
Really stylish. Good service and food. A little bit small the gym.
All fancy Price high but the, have a realy good night bar.

adr_address: 19, Calle de Alcalá, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: 19, Calle de Alcalá, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Regina Madrid

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a week in April 2019. The entire experience was great. The location is very central. Only one issue that there is construction going on in front of the hotel so it can be a bit loud and dusty outside at times. The front desk staff was very helpful in guiding us with any questions about any tourist spots on the map they provided. They were always very courteous and quick at assisting if any issues came up. The issues were very minor. The room was very nice and clean and the bed was very comfortable. Excellent hotel, good amenities and staff and great location. Highly recommended!

Really liked my experience here. The breakfast is amazing and Gledy is really dedicated to make you comfortable. 
Amazing location as well. You will be at the center of the town. I will come back with no hesitation.

Not the worst hotel I have stayed in Spain but I don't think the level of service they provide equals the prices they charge. I had an issue when checking in as I paid for a suite and was given a room of about 12 ft by 14ft with a small bathroom to the side. In fairness they did move me to a suite when I addressed the matter with the reception staff. Being near the centre if the city meant a good choice of restaurants and shops for down time. I think the city is beautiful and the people are always amazingly friendly. The food away from the hotel is excellent and I will go back to Madrid but will stay elsewhere.
Beautiful hotel. Perfect location. Loved it

very good location .
very good service in the front desk , nice and polite staff
and vety good staff in the breakfast room

adr_address: Calle de San Bernardo, 1, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de San Bernardo, 1, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Santo Domingo

reviews.text: good breakfast, close to many good sights!  not a 4 star hotel from my point of view, sits on a very busy and noisy street. rooms are good isolated from other rooms, did wake up multiple times a night due to noise from the street (ask for a room on the other side). hotel needs to improve its climate control. rooms are either hot or icecold, same for the conference rooms. My room was above the entrance and very hot, could not open window at night because of the noise, and constantly smelled smoke from the people outside (not sure where it came from).

This hotel was disgusting! The room smelled of mist and mold, the beds in the room were stained and both smelled of urine (to a point we had to call for more towels to lay down on the bed) not only did it feel like a jail cell it was dirty. Stains throughout the room (sink was brown, counters were chipped & stained, carpet felt like turf and was also stained) we immediately left after the first Night. Luckily, we were only locked in for one night and were able to move only down the block to a beautiful, clean hotel. The customer service was 0 help. Apparently, the hotel manager is nose blind, because the scent of urine literally woke us up out of our sleep through a towel and throughout the night. Because she couldn’t smell it when she checked the room (and I don’t know how) there was no refund from the hotel. Woof. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Very convenient location in centre of Madrid with 3min of walking distance to grand via. And just to pint point for or the non walkers metro station is just outside of the hotel. Clean rooms, comfortable bed nothing I can complain on. Definitely recommended for stay!
Very beautiful and homely, will always recommend for visitors all over the world

Worst hotel ever. We paid 274 euro for one night in this 117 room. Room really small. We are a group of 3. Room really small that cannot even open the luggage. We spend two night in another room few days before (140) is small but acceptable. This room is horrible. The 3rd bed is facing toilet with really bad smell. Cannot open the closet at all. Cannot even open the door for the safety box. Really old hotel !!!!? Stay Away! 
Poor reception

adr_address: Calle de Mesonero Romanos, 13, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Mesonero Romanos, 13, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Tryp Madrid Cibeles

reviews.text: A good little find. Great location and amenities. Within walking distance to anywhere in Madrid.

2 star only for location as the location is excellent and good value for money

Apart from that the furniture is worn out, room size are just ok

But the big problem is their the central system. It either cools or heats. When we stayed during April the weather was changing from winter to summer and days were Hot and nights pleasant so in afternoon you have to open your windows if you want to be alive, the staff cannot do anything about this
Very nice and neat. A well oranized place.
Good rooms.  Great location.  Super friendly staff.
Rooms are old furnished. But the breakfeast is amaizing do not miss.

adr_address: Calle Gran Vía, 25, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Gran Vía, 25, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Madrid Gran Vía 25 by Melia

reviews.text: Location is great but... the hotel is extremely noisy : neighbours, elevator, staff, you hear everything. Forget about a restful night unless you have very good earplugs. Poor cleaning: I found glass pieces on the floor of the bathroom two days in a row. Wouldn’t recommend for business trips.

Close to several restaurants and places you must know when visiting Madrid. Good breakfast with juices, many coffees flavours, which is open until 11:00, so you might consider it a brunch also. Rooms are ok, very clean, but lack some space for clothes if you have 2 or more mid-big sized valises. Good bed and shower. Free Wi-Fi is ok for non-intensive use.
Not bad for a 3 star hotel, the breakfast is good.
Nice hotel but doesn't care about others, only about itself #Sota
Great location, good breakfirst

adr_address: Calle de la Princesa, 27, 28008 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Princesa, 27, 28008 Madrid, Spain
name: Meliá Madrid Princesa

reviews.text: This hotel was stunning. The rooms were very clean, stylish and just made you feel great. The staff was welcoming and very helpful in booking activities and making reservations. We arrived early and was able to check in early. The hotel is not far from the town center where many attractions are. The hotel is very posh and you can stay and just hang out there if you dont want to go out. I would definitely come back. Restaurant in hotel is great. Wonderful breakfast choices. And they will cater to vegans and vegetarians. Loved it.

Feels like a forced five star. Very small room, and irritating common toiletries in the name of pollution control. 
Staff is nice, but if you're going to speak in English, speak slowly so that they comprehend easily.

Breakfast is nice, Very trendy.

BTW, the complimentary chocolate at the Level is too good to miss. (PS, they might give you a suspicious look if you grab more than one ;-) )

Negatives:
Bedside light fixture in room was broken.

Room had stains on the wall.

Cheap finish.

You can hear everything from upstairs room.

Room is quite small.

No greeting from evening doormen. Too busy chatting to eachother.

Positives:

Bed was comfortable.
Breakfast was Great.
Nice views of Madrid City
Great location.
Ricardo night manager - very good.
Victor from room service- very Good.

Location is convenient to a lot of attractions.  Almost no need to take any transit around.
Good breakfast, very helpful front desk staff.
Special thanks to a young man in the priority check in counter on April 26.
Warm gesture from the customer services manager with good wishes and a bottle of champagne for our anniversary day.

In the heart of the city 
Friendly, efficient staff.
Excellent breakfast.
Modern but not ultra-modern.

adr_address: Calle de Cedaceros, 4, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Cedaceros, 4, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Vincci Centrum

reviews.text: Great Location.  Great staff.  Rooms are clean and adequate. The location of the Hotel means that only a few rooms have a view of the street. Most rooms will have a view of a wall. The Televison should have more English speaking channels.

This was great! I would have given it five stars, but unfortunately there wasn’t a boiler, and we had to drink tap water. The room also had a weird smell to it, but otherwise, it was fine. The staff was friendly, and they had breakfast there. The beds are very comfortable, and there was a tv, and comfortable seats. The bathroom was spacious, with 2 sinks and shower+ tub, and they give us body milk, shampoo, hair cover, dental kits, and a razor kit. It was very comfortable, and they had a fridge, and the charging of devices was fast for the most part. (Important tip: When going to Spain, please, bring an adapter if you’re from America, I don’t know what adapter you need to buy, but the outlets there differ from the ones in the US. If your going to charge your phone, or iPad, do not use charger heads that belong to another device, because using the devices own charger head usually makes the charging go faster.) The WiFi was great, but it could be slow at times. We stayed here 2 days, both times it was great.

We were at the Vincci Centrum from 21.12-24.12.18 in room 303 and we forgot a pair of yeezy sneakers in the room. We called some days later to ask if they could send us the sneakers and they told us on the phone that the sneakers are still there and we should write an e-mail describing the situation - which we did. We never received an answer. Also they discounted me 78 euros from my credit card as a kind of a depot which I never got back although I asked for them at the reception and they confirmed they would send me back my money. 
please can you react at least now?

Location is very good. The staff is very helpful. My room is on top floor and it gets very hot by some reason. The room size and the layout is good. I am very pleased. The breakfast is compact but contains many alternatives for any taste.
It was a very pleasant experience, the service was great, the elevators were in a good state and they even gave you food as a present.

adr_address: Calle de López de Hoyos, 143, 28002 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de López de Hoyos, 143, 28002 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel ILUNION Suites Madrid

reviews.text: The hotel is an excellent place to rest after a long day. The beds are sufficient, the shower is good and the breakfast is good. It's all there it just misses the details. Nonetheless I would sleep here again!
Great suites, great looks, very comfortable and helpful staff.
Great hotel! Good spaces, great rooms, the breakfast has a lot of variety and the staff is simply the best.
The rooms were clean and very spacious. It's right next to the metro so that's very convenient. It's a little far from the center but you can easily take the metro. It's also closer to the airport.
Good value hotel. Very friendly staff. Nice firm bed. Good wi-fi and good old fashion fast Ethernet ports available. Good breakfast.

vicinity: Calle de López de Hoyos, 143, Madrid

adr_address: Av. General, 49, 28042 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Av. General, 49, 28042 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel ibis Madrid Aeropuerto Barajas

reviews.text: Good clean room. Fair price. Breakfast basic but as much as you want. Shuttle to and from airport included but don't rely on driver to know your terminal for you.

Good location, comfortable bed, great price. What more could you ask for?  The rooms are a reasonable size and provide a quiet and comfortable night's sleep. The shower needed a little attention which was a minor issue but I expect everything to be work properly and be in good order so I have given only 4 stars this time.  Barajas Madrid is a brilliant place to stay, nice bars, cafes, restaurants and shops. Good transport links to Madrid, Ifema, and the Airport.

We had to stay there one night with our dog and the staff team was very welcoming and friendly with us at all times. They even gave our dog a toy for free! The stay was very comfortable in general. The only negative thing was that the bus service to the airport that they provide does not allow dogs, so we had to pay for a taxi. But I highly recommend this hotel!
Beautiful clean hotel. Near to the airport with free transfer bus. 10 min from the metro walking . We enjoyed our stay there. Breakfast could be more special. :)

Everything is maintained very professionally for a very moderate price. A perfect place to overnight close to the Madrid airport. The shuttle bus operates frequently and it it possible to call it from the terminals.

adr_address: Calle de Rufino González, 19, 28037 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Rufino González, 19, 28037 Madrid, Spain
name: ibis budget Madrid Calle Alcalá

reviews.text: Clean , good budget hotel, near the subway, great for short work trips
Nice and very clean. I was impressed
Helpful friendly service and secure but pricey parking
Nice rooms, good breakfast and great staff
Close to metro station and supermarket. Good free WiFi and breakfast.

adr_address: Calle de San Agustín, 3, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de San Agustín, 3, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: DoubleTree by Hilton Madrid - Prado

reviews.text:
Friendly staff, great service! Loved the warm welcome-cookie when we arrived from heavy rain outside. 
The room was modern and clean, comfortable bed and spacious shower. The hotel looks very thought through, and it lies quite close to the metro. Nice restaurant and bar at the hotel.

This hotel has a boutique feeling very cozy and quaint.  The rooms were spotless and the entire hotel was put together well.  It is well located to explore the museums and not too far from Sol near the center.  The only downside was that a subway or train station is a hike esp if you have luggage.  The breakfast was good.

This hotel is centrally located near the parliament! Great location!! The staff is super generous and super kind, we came in on early flight and I had told them I would be arriving at 11 AM and showed up around 9:30 as my light came in early, they still had a room ready for me! The room was clean and decent sized. The highlight of this hotel is their staff!?

Great location. Great service. 

Hot water with real water pressure = perfection.  Every hotel in Europe has very hot water for showers, but most lack proper water pressure. DoubleTree delivers on both. It’s the small things that make a big difference. 

Clean rooms. Attentive staff. Actual iron and ironing board in room. Nespresso coffee machine. 

Feels like you’re home. 

Will be back for sure.

Great experience here on a 6 days stay.  Our room is a good size and cleaned as requested. Quiet and relaxing atmosphere. Breakfast choices are good since it's included for us. Location is in the center area, accessible to places where we want to explore. Short walk for our tours meet up and to our fave hang out area Mercado San Miguel. Will come back in a heartbeat when we're in this beautiful city again❤❤❤

adr_address: Calle de Atocha, 83, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Atocha, 83, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: TRYP Madrid Atocha Hotel

reviews.text: Great hotel. Clean, well equipped and maintained, and the staff was responsive and very friendly and helpful.

We had an issue with our air conditioner and the hotel staff was very fast to resolve the issue and change our room. That was very nice. Hotel itself is a little older but very nice and in the center of everything. All of the staff was great and breakfast was good. Went to the hotel bar for drinks and the bartender brought out chips without being asked and then charged us 2 Euro which was a little irritating. Overall good stay and would recommend the hotel.

Top hotel in the city center of Madrid. Very well located close to the main transportation and 10mn walk from Atocha train station. The personnel is pleasant and speak with no surprise perfect english (except for personnel of late room service). The room was quiet, well equiped, king size bed, big bath room but no separate wc. Top mention to the breakfast, diverse and good continental style with good service. One star less for some carpet to renew in the public floor area and tv offer (i had to find something to  improve;)

The location of the hotel is relatively good. The metro entrance is practically at the door and the main atractions of Madrid are within walking distance. The staff is friendly, the room was big and clean. The only problem with it is that it had no window. Worth mentioning, the bartender was all the time on the phone and he doesn't speak a word in english! We couldn't even order water...

It is a decent hotel that is well located. I would consider this a three star hotel. The rooms are small but clean. The air-conditioning could be better though. The staff and house cleaning are friendly and competent. It is VERY close to the Prado, Reina Sofia, Plaza Mayor and Palacio Real.

adr_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 3, 28004 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Hortaleza, 3, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Petit Palace Chueca

reviews.text: Nice Hotel right in the middle of the city.  Cool that they have family rooms with a set of bunk beds.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were very clean and modern.
Great hotel.  Very comfortable.  Off Gran Via and close to everything.  The front desk and housekeeping staff are terrific.  Lovely hotel.  Highly recommend!
Great location! Breakfast is fine and the rooms are also fine. Strongly recommends!!!

The location of the hotel was great. It is very close to Gran Via shopping and metro station (Chueca metro is about a 5 minute walk). There are many shops and restaurants located on this street as well.

The first room we checked into had balcony doors that did not lock. For safety reasons, we contacted front desk about this and the issue was resolved very quickly with a room switch. 

Room-wise, it was spacious and plenty of electrical outlets. However, there was only 1 towel in the bathroom even though the room had two beds and booked for two. The hotel has a cool elevator..the ones you see in movies. Breakfast is located in the building next door (the Celioso bakery in fact) but connected on the main floor by elevators. 

Entry into the hotel can be annoying. I did not see a card scanner to open the doors. Therefore, the front desk has to buzz you in everytime.

adr_address: Calle Gran Vía, 41, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Gran Vía, 41, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Vincci Capitol Hotel

reviews.text: Amazing Location. The hotel it's not bad but needs a lot of maintenance. When arrived the sink was stuck and after the shower the floor was very wet due to the seal of the shower door which was broken. There is no desk and  and the wardrobe is very small. We couldn't sleep well because you can hear the noise from the other rooms and from the hallway which is very smelly. I was surprised about the cleaning. They only tided my bed and changed the  towels(we are 2 guests and they gave us only 1) I had to ask for the products for the shower they didn't replace the old ones. I will probably suggest this hotel for the location and that's all. The price is not fair for the quality of the services. Again We were happy to pay for the location.

Best location in Madrid city centre, is very reasonably priced for where it is €99, very clean, great view up the Via Calle, lots of high street shopping and also the lovely quaint boutiques close by. Try the Nada Bar close by for great whisky!
Was on 9th floor so great views. Breakfast good. Needs some attention to decor. Plugs ( bathroom) broken etc  Great venue to visit Madrid

Unrespectful staff (one of them not all) room floor has scratches and the faucet is not in good condition.... Also the hallway has a hole in the roof , instead of fixing it they blocked the entire hallway and we had to walk around the hallway to get in our room instead of 30 seconds walking we had to walk for around 2 minutes.
Their view is perfect and the other staff in reception were really helpful but we had unpleasant experience with one of them

Stayed one night for business
The computer was down and passports couldn't be registered on arrival. The rooms were wrong doubles instead of twins and vice versa, keys not working and double booked rooms.
Building work and drilling during the day?
The bar shut at 11pm in a major city?
The hotel and breakfast are nice.
Organisation leaves a bit to be desired

adr_address: Plaza de Celenque, 3, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza de Celenque, 3, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: TOC Hostel Madrid

reviews.text: Could not turn down the  heating. Otherwise an excellent location,  great room in a shared 6 bed dorm, at a great price. Staff are extremely helpful at all times.   I will recommend this Hostel to all my travelling friends.

Great hostel. Wonderful attention and very very excellent location. You have Plaza del Sol nearby as well as a couple of minutes walk to Downtown Madrid's main tourist point and the room lock is with fingerprint so it's quite secure. Recommend, modern and clean.
Really nice hostel! Cosy, fresh and good service
8 person room with enough space to feel alone. Also not expensive.
Amazing communal area with a great bar. Very beautiful interior design. Love it.

adr_address: Paseo de la Castellana, 259, B, 28046 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Paseo de la Castellana, 259, B, 28046 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Eurostars Madrid Tower

reviews.text: It was amazing, good customer service. Too bad they don't have hotel shuttles to the airport, or the airport to the hotel. But everything else was good, the room was very complex and organized. Breakfast was a delight, aswell as the gym & spa. What a wonderful experience.
Great hotel. Good location. Has everything to the highest standard. Staff were very helpful and welcoming ( multilingual). Plus the food was unbelievable.

Really nice hotel in the centre of Madrid. It is one of the tallest buildings in the city and the interior looks marvellous. I did not sleep in the hotel though. I just went there for a Bachata Congress, but looking at the style of the hotel, I imagine that the rooms should be quite nice and with a wonderful view over Madrid.

They just have a “fancy” look. Behind the look, the reality / the whole experience is super negative. As they know you are travelling for business (- thus it is your company that pays at the end of the day), they just charge ridiculous prices for anything. Restaurant is super bad. If you want to pay a lot of money for average room and bad quality food,  this is the place to be.

Incredible views from all the rooms and great spacious rooms with baths and huge showers. Clean and very comfy. 
However the spa is basic and missing the luxurious touch. We were there for only a one night stay and they were unable to accommodate us for any spa treatments or massages despite my having tried to book this in advance (my emails were ignored).
The breakfast was amazing, worth the money. But I would recommend they get a new toaster 😂 you'll wait an eternity.

vicinity: Paseo de la Castellana, 259, B, Madrid

adr_address: Calle de la Princesa, 40, 28008 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Princesa, 40, 28008 Madrid, Spain
name: Courtyard by Marriott Madrid Princesa

reviews.text:
Good hotel with all amenities.
Great location. Near to the metro and all around are good restaurants. Big hotel with all that you need. The breakfast is quite good with everything

We had a great stay here.  Navigation can be tough as the entrance is not directly on Calle de la Princesa, but there's a driveway to stop your car and check in (and park, if you're okay with the $24/day parking). Not everyone spoke English (we are American), but we had no trouble communicating what we needed or finding someone who understood).  There is a fitness center and pool in the basement level.  There is a restaurant on the ground floor and a buffet breakfast on the first floor  Very close to the Royal Palace, and right next to the subway system!

Had a premium room, which was really nice and spacey. Helpful and friendly staff. That's the two stars. But sleeping here is not easy. You can very loud and clearly hear everything from the street, even on the seventh floor. So, if you stay here, bring ear plugs. In addition, the breakfast und dinner are prepared very well, but don't taste very well. I skipped breakfast completely after the first day. To sum up, a hotel where you can't sleep or eat very well. No point to stay here really.

Staff was disinterested in guest comfort. Refrigerator was broken, A/C was spotty, room became extremely warm at night (~81°). Hotel response was "open the window". Will not stay here again, especially at this price.

Old hotel that shows it's age. Gym is a public gym that is always crowded and it smells. Bed squeaks and the mattress is sub par. Location is good. Breakfast buffet is very good. Staff is friendly. There's a taxi stand right outside the hotel. A big supermarket and other shopping is next door.

adr_address: Av. de Pío XII, 77, 28016 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Av. de Pío XII, 77, 28016 Madrid, Spain
name: ILUNION Pío XII

reviews.text:
Early check in 40 EUR. Yes I don't like this kind of surprises. Alway was free in different hotels. My opinion 1 star + bubble gum in the bath. 

123 £ - cost of 4 days
123 £ / 4 = 30.75 cost of 1 day

yearly check in 38.32 £ - more then 1 day. What the ... ?

Nice room, clean & big, with king-size bed and we're lucky though stay for 3 nights and got the price really cheap than apartment since me & my bf looking for a place to stay on Airbnb but couldn't find any better place with good price

Not 4* but nice and clean nonetheless. Bulbs out in our room, no vanity mirror, window broken and third bed very uncomfortable. Weirdly, no tea and coffee-making facilities...bus stop right outside for Sol and the centre so very convenient
Excellent hotel. Good location for the airport and nearby embassies. Good value for money and they also help lots of people. A nice place to be and a good example
Nice clean rooms friendly staff some English speaking staff decent food

adr_address: Calle de O'Donnell, 53, 28009 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de O'Donnell, 53, 28009 Madrid, Spain
name: Novotel Madrid Center

reviews.text:
Nice, very nice indeed. 
The service is pleasant.
The place it's very multifaceted.
Works for big groups or for individuals business presence.
Have a small swimming pool but a nice terrace bar.
I didn't use the parking so i don't have a formal opinion.
Instead,  it's possible to park around of the hotel, exist two zones with limited of  4 hours.
The price can be a bit.
At this time i payed 180€ per night in regime of B&B.
Price $$$+

Probably the best breakfast I have had in a hotel... Ever?! Broccoli, aubergine, salad and even cauliflower available as well as plenty of protein (eggs, omelettes, cold meats, sausages, smoked salmon and a variety of cheese as well as yoghurt). Freshly made smoothies were available and a variety of bread / cereal. The reception staff were always helpful and obliging and the food menu in the bar was nice and healthy and available until late - so you could have something like lentil soup at about 10pm if you hadn't had time to eat. I didn't have much time to explore the rest of the hotel much but I would definitely stay again and take the family AND recommend the hotel to other people. Definitely a lovely and well-situated base for exploring Madrid 👌🏼 (Also liked the living wall in the foyer - very cool)

The restaurant and room service is 24hrs!
As you can see in this picture I posted, the meal portions are really large, and delicious!
I should recommend a red wine Tempranillo.
Excellent hotel. Nice rooms and clean. Very helpful front desk
Fantastic hotel, good base for exploring Madrid, metro station 2 minutes walk, rooms fine, breakfast fantastic everything you could want. Good bar and reasonable prices

adr_address: 19248 Hita, Guadalajara, Guadalajara, Spain
formatted_address: 19248 Hita, Guadalajara, Guadalajara, Spain
name: Casa Rural Cueva de la Cereria

reviews.text: Casa cómoda, muy bien situada para visitar la Alcarria. Los dueños son un encanto.

address_components.long_name: Calle de la Virgen de la Cuesta
address_components.short_name: Calle de la Virgen de la Cuesta

adr_address: Calle de la Virgen de la Cuesta, 19248 Hita, Guadalajara, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Virgen de la Cuesta, 19248 Hita, Guadalajara, Spain
name: Casa Rural Doña Garosa

reviews.text:
Nos encantó una casa rural super acogedora.
Pueded acudir con tus mascotas y tienen mucho espacio donde correr, una piscina ideal volveremos en verano
Nos encanto lugar y la casita, lo unico q estaba un poco dejada en detalles de limpieza el resto todo bien no pudimos disfrutar mucho de eya.

Espectacular entorno de la casa,relajante,patio con encanto, bodega para siesta fresquita,muy accesible sin problemas para aparcar.Estuvimos seis personas en familia un findesemana y no nos falto de nada,el dueño muy atento y flexible con la hora de salida de la casa.Muy recomendable,volveremos en invierno para usar la chimenea,gracias por todo.

Totalmente recomendable,una casa muy comoda,que junto al patio y piscina hacen la estacia  muy agradable,la casa con todo lo necesario,los colchones muy cómodos,fuimos a descansar y así fue,Hita es un pueblo precioso,seguro que volveremos.

Nos ha encantado el patio y la bodega, además al estar en el centro del pueblo nos peemitio disfrutar de todo.
En definitiva, la casa fantastica, limpia y calidad precio inmejorable, el dueño nos atendio muy bien y atento. Totalmente recomendable, volveremos.

vicinity: Calle de la Virgen de la Cuesta, Hita

adr_address: Calle Real, 21, 19237 Fuencemillán, Guadalajara, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Real, 21, 19237 Fuencemillán, Guadalajara, Spain

Casa Rural la Casa Grande de Fuencemillan

reviews.text: Lugar tranquilo y agradable de trato cercano y familiar, ideal para ir con niños y disfrutar del entorno. Todo impecable y limpio. La casa la lleva un matrimonio  muy amable que te hace sentir como si estuvieras en familia. Para repetir sin duda.
Limpieza y amplitud. Comida casera con productos de su huerta. Gente muy agradable. Recomendable.
El alojamiento impecable y buena comida. Trato cordial y agradable.
Una experiencia única, un trato inmejorable. Que comida más rica! Esteban y Esperanza súper agradables! Repetiremos sin duda!!

Es un buen sitio para ir si tienes en cuenta que:

- La atención es inexistente, ineficaz y muy muy mejorable.

- No es accesible ni adecuada para niños. Entre otros detalles, escaleras de caracol sin barrotes, chimenea sin protección...

- El termo de agua no llega para llenar la bañera.

- Si quieres usas la chimenea, lleva leña porque no lo avisan, te la querrán vender y no encontrarás ni la de cortesía.

- Bombillas gastadas por toda la casa y luz escasa.

- Los radiadores son eléctricos y con 18° en el exterior tardaron el calentar la casa más de 24h. La planta baja hasta los 2 días no había quién estuviera.

- La casa está limpia y cuenta con ropa de cama, toallas y mantas.

- La cocina está equipada con nevera, horno, cafetera, tostadora, lavadora y diferentes utensilios básicos (olla, cazo, escurridor y menaje para 4)

- Se echa en falta tabla para cortar, sartén, útiles como cuchara de madera o algo para servir y sobretodo tendedero, cubo y fregona. La bañera no tiene ni mampara ni cortina.

- Las vistas desde la casa son muy bonitas,  a la montaña.

- El entorno es lo mejor. El pueblo es bonito, muy tranquilo. Tiene un pequeño río, aunque algo descuidado y se come bien.
Muy completo y cómodo. Recomendable.

La ubicación es inigualable, un pueblo precioso. Una lastima un sitio tan caro para lo que ofrecen. Te lo venden como casa rural para dos y en realidad no llega a ser un apartamento, donde cocina, salón y dormitorio se encuentran en la misma habitación. Esto supone cero de intimidad puesto que las ventanas no tiene persianas o contraventanas. El baño es muy incomodo con una bañera y el grifo tipo ducha sin presión. 
Faltaba menaje de cocina y la bombilla de la mesita de noche.

On a recent vacation to Spain in April, we had the chance to eat at the restaurant in Hotel Quercus Tierra while visiting a friend in Garganta de los Montes.  The food, view, and overall experience was beyond our expectations!  Wonderful food and drinks from start to finish.  Fresh ingredients combined with a few traditional Spanish dishes as well as a few dishes from around southern Spain (bread and tomatoes) and France ( foie gras).  The steak was local and absolutely delicious.  If you are lucky enough to find yourself near Garganta, Hotel Quercus Tierra offers great food and a great place to stay while taking in the charm of a small Spanish village.  Can't say enough about the friendly staff and was lucky enough to spend some time with the owner too!  Thanks for the great dining experience and the wonderful hospitality.  Best of luck with the venture and for those who make it, enjoy!
