reviews.text: Trato muy amable por parte de la casa, buenas habitaciones, limpieza un 8 de 10, el desayuno esta muy bien, el spa no lo probé pero si vuelvo a rascafria sin duda es mi lugar de alojamiento
El sitio es preciso, muy tranquilo y con todo lo necesario para pasar un fin de semana estupendo. Buena calefacción,sauna, jacuzzi, chimenea, buen desayuno..... Qué más quieres ?
Es un lugar muy bonito rasca fría

Alojamiento rural en el mismo Rascafrías, en el que puedes disfrutar de sauna y jacuzzi. Nosotros hemos estado en una suite con salón y bañera con ventanas en techo, cama de 160, baño y salón. Personal muy amable. Desayuno incluido, tostadas, bollería, cereales, café y leche.

Estuvimos este fin de semana alojadas en los Espinares y la verdad q  la estancia fue perfecta, la habitación acogedora y muy limpia, vistas a la montaña, el lugar muy tranquilo donde es fácil poder desconectar, tanto los dueños como el servicio muy amables y atentos y el desayuno es estilo buffet y es variado. No dudaríamos el volver a repetir.

adr_address: Av. de España, 28791 Soto del Real, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Av. de España, 28791 Soto del Real, Madrid, Spain
name: Los Corrales de Soto

reviews.text: Surprisingly good music (bubble band ex leader), lovely terrace, good artisanal red beer from la sierra de Madrid, what else can we ask?
Really nice with good food/drinks and live music.

Increíble atención de la recepción y trato muy agradable. Hotel rural pequeño, tranquilo y muy acogedor, con trato familiar y excepcional limpieza. Aceptan mascotas, además hay un parque grande enfrente. Buena localización.

Lugar perfecto donde puedes descansar (casa rural) con todo lo necesario y muy bien acondicionada.
La dueña te ayuda en todo lo posible y admiten animales.

Acudí en noviembre por lo que la terraza no la pude disfrutar.

La comida sensacional, recomiendo parar y comer, sale a unos 20€ por persona con entrante y postre.
- canelones de boletus (probar y opinar 😊)
- hamburguesas de la casa
- tarta de zanahoria (rica pero no asombrosa)
Comida deliciosa. Conciertos en verano estupendos. Trato genial...terracita qué mas se puede pedir!!!!

vicinity: Avenida de España, Soto del Real

adr_address: Av. de Madrid, 68, 28710 El Molar, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Av. de Madrid, 68, 28710 El Molar, Madrid, Spain
name: Hostal Landhaus

reviews.text:
Great place, very easy to access from A1.
Modern, the rooms are immaculate, bathrooms perfect.
"Restaurant" is too strong a word. Bar/cafe is better with a good choice of home made burgers at good prices.
Try the 1906 malt ale - beautiful!!
Good, clean, friendly staff, relatively close (30 minutes) to the airport.
Stayed here a few times now, rooms are exceptionally clean and tidy, friendly staff, always helpful. Perfect overnight stop. Easy to find, loads of parking. What more is required.
The hostal Was good located, room was confortable and modern. Food was delicious, cheap and fast served.
We were very well looked after here ,will definitely go back

adr_address: Calle de las Eras, 35-37, 28739 Gargantilla del Lozoya, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de las Eras, 35-37, 28739 Gargantilla del Lozoya, Madrid, Spain
name: Hospedería Del Valle

reviews.text: Good value for two rooms, location close to local resorts and natural swimming pools.
Really lovely place. Surroundings and scenery are so beautiful.  Rooms clean and cosy. Helpfull and nice staff.

Hemos pasado unos días muy tranquilos y desconectados del trabajo y de la rutina diaria en la Hospedería del Valle.
Las instalaciones son perfectas y la limpieza impecable. A destacar la comodidad del colchón en el que hemos descansando sin ninguna prisa para madrugar.
Muchas gracias Javier por la información tan completa que nos has dado sobre los sitios que visitar y dónde poder comer o tomar unas buenas tapas. Gracias por tu amabilidad y hospitalidad. Y, sobre todo, gracias Javier por tu ilusión y tesón para que Gargantilla del Lozoya no sea uno m��s de tantos pequeños pueblos abandonados y olvidados. 
Un saludo desde Getafe de Antonio y Nieves.
Hasta pronto.
Muy agradable lugar, la planta primera con apartamentos muy  completos. Bien decorado y agradable. Puedes llevar tu mascota
Es encantador, precioso, limpio y tranquilo. El dueño es súper amable.

vicinity: Calle de las Eras, 35-37, Gargantilla del Lozoya

adr_address: Calle de Ramón Gabriel, 28, 28710 El Molar, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Ramón Gabriel, 28, 28710 El Molar, Madrid, Spain
name: La Posada De Lola

reviews.text: Warm welcome and host. Super helpful. Clean apartment, very spacious. Very convenient location.
Polite and helpful staff! Beautiful, clean, traditional apartment. Rich breakfast! Bottle of shampain! The apartment is just a little bit dark! But Romantic!
Cool food
Genial el alojamiento y el trato. María es encantadora
Un alojamiento muy agradable lo hemos visto para hospedarnos  en una boda.

vicinity: Calle de Ramón Gabriel, 28, El Molar

adr_address: Calle del Artiñuelo, 4, 28740 Rascafría, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle del Artiñuelo, 4, 28740 Rascafría, Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel rural "Casa Granero"

reviews.text: La dueña muy amable, el desayuno muy rico, pero el hotel está viejo respecto de las fotos originales que aparecen, la chimenea no está preparada y cuesta mucho encenderla (a no ser que te intoxiques de pastillas de gasolina) había un sofá sucio y un camastro más sucio aún y telarañas y bichos, necesita una reforma para ser lo que parece fue en otro tiempo. Calidad/Precio no lo recomiendo

La dueña es muy amable y te guía mucho a la hora de hacer actividades por el pueblo. Las habitaciones son grandes y el ambiente muy tranquilo 100% rural.
La única pega que pondría es que en el baño no ponen cepillo de dientes, pasta, peine etc.
Pero por lo demás lo recomiendo.

Lo mejor, la acogida por parte de la persona al cargo, que te hace sentir en casa y te informa de todo lo interesante para ver, caminar y visitar en la zona.
Lo peor, el compartir el desayuno con el resto de los clientes alojados y la nula insonorización de las habitaciones, que hizo que "nos tragásemos" todas las acciones amorosas y las discusiones de los de la habitación de al lado... Y después, desayunar a su lado, pues es una única mesa grande, esperando a ser servidos, pues nos juntamos muchos y había que esperar por casi todo para comer.
El hotel rural ha debido conocer tiempos mejores y ahora empiezan a notarse el paso del tiempo, los desperfectos y la  escasez en lo mínimo de cada habitación.

Un sitio precioso donde poder escaparte con tu pareja. Un tranquilidad plena y una localización inmejorable. 

Me encantó como está realizado por dentro con vigas de madera, en cuanto a las habitaciones son silenciosas y amplias. La dueña es muy amable. Sin duda alguna repetiremos.

Claramente se trata de un establecimiento venido a menos. Las fotos de las habitaciones nada tienen que ver con la realidad actual (los sofás no se corresponden siendo antiquísimos e incómodos, no hay sillas, los detalles de decoración han desaparecido.......).
En cuanto a lo positivo, la dueña es muy amable y no pone pega a ninguna petición.
Con una remodelación de pintura y redecoración el establecimiento sería espectacular, pero a día de hoy yo no repetiría puesto que no cumple con las expectativas que genera.

adr_address: Pino, 2 Urb. Atalaya Real, 28723 Pedrezuela, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Pino, 2 Urb. Atalaya Real, 28723 Pedrezuela, Madrid, Spain
name: Casa Tula

reviews.text: Casa muy agradable y muy bien equipada a unos minutos del pantano. La dueña encantadora. Muy recomendable

Hemos pasado un fin de semana genial con amigos, la casa es grande, totalmente equipada, no le falta detalle, jardín amplio para que los niños jueguen, con su barbacoa, su piscina, etc... lo dicho, no le falta de nada, se puede ir a pasear tranquilamente al embalse o incluso a Pedrezuela, esta bien situada.
La casa tiene todo tipo de detalles, la dueña es majisima y muy atenta, hemos pasado toda la familia allí el fin de año y hemos estado muy agusto. La recomiendo al 100%
Un magnífico sitio para ir a pasar unos días muy limpio muy cuidado muchísimos detalles. Se disfruta de mucho silencio y mucha paz.
Estupenda casa.

adr_address: Calle Juan Rizi, 5, 28027 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Juan Rizi, 5, 28027 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Silken Puerta Madrid

reviews.text: Nice and clean hotel. Tasty breakfast. The only minus for me was slow elevator. There are only two elevators for the guests and there was traffic in the morning.
Very nice and hospitality is good.

It's an okay hotel. On the outskirts but has good bus connections to the city. Near the airport which is great. Service is variable. Great at the front desk - bar leaves you waiting without acknowledgement. Don't stay here for the food.
Excellent price quality , super fast check in and check out, just breakfast coffee machine  must be improved

It was nice
Special thanks to AITOR, IRENE,JAVIER & ROSSIO

adr_address: 28007, Calle del Pez Volador, 1, 28007 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: 28007, Calle del Pez Volador, 1, 28007 Madrid, Spain
name: Ayre Gran Hotel Colón

reviews.text:
At the time we arrived it was a 15 minute taxi ride from the airport, which was a fixed price of 30 Euro. We were welcomed at reception and the check in process was very efficient. Our room was very convenient being a few steps up to the first floor (so no need for having to use the lifts). The room was clean, tidy with housekeeping done daily. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom had an excellent shower, shaving mirror, hair dryer, complimentary toothbrush, toothpaste, shower gel, soap. Things like the heated mirror over the sink, so that it does not steam up when you have a shower, might be a small touch, but just makes the stay a little more pleasant.

The breakfast catered for all of your needs, be it cereal, cooked food, pastries, fruit, meats and cheeses.

Situated near to a park and with restaurants just down the road. A walk through the park to the centre of Madrid takes approximately 30minutes or for those wanting to save their energy, local buses or taxi's are available.

I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again, the staff were very pleasant an very helpful.

Madrid is a beautiful city and we'll worth a visit. We had a thoroughly enjoyable time.

Enjoyed my stay here. The room was large and clean. The bathroom was modern and the shower was powerful. The buffet breakfast in the morning was great and had the usual continental range of food.

It's quite far out from the city centre but that means it's in a less touristy area than other hotels might be found and I think this is a good thing.

There aren't that many decent restaurants in the surrounding area but Madrid in general is not fantastic for food in the first place.

First of all - the photo from the roof is only for marketing. Guests are not allowed to get up to the top floor anymore (since more then a year, when the bar at the top was closed, I have asked receptionist for this information).

The hotel is split in two buildings, you cannot choose where you want to get the room during booking but you will notice at breakfast in which of the buildings you have been put. If you get the good one you are in a fairly nice place with quite some range of different meals to choose. In case you need to move to the cellar for breakfast you are in the "wrong" building and your experience will be not that good anymore. Only a small amount of daylight and only standard food will make you feel that you have paid to much for this poor start into the day.

The rooms are generally okay, not on the top but also no negative surprises. The furnishing and devices only vary slightly from room to room, so standard comfort you will experience either way.

Am advantage is the good infrastructure and the Retiro (big park) is also only a few minutes walk. A Shisha Bar and some places to go for a drink in the evening are also only round the corner. Nothing to worry about.

Have a great trip and save stay!
Convenient location. Good clean rooms. Small thrift shops nearby.

In fact these are two buildings separated from each other. They don't inform about it when you make a booking. You have to wait long for elevators. 
I have chosen a room with king size bed but received two single ones separated.
Breakfast is auwfull - almost zero choice. 
Interior is decent. Localization is quite ok.

adr_address: Calle de Sagasta, 22, 28004 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Sagasta, 22, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Safestay Madrid

reviews.text:
Spotlessly clean. Nice staff. Great common area

Only downside is the check out time is too early... i.e. 10am
This was one of the nicest hostels I’ve ever been to. Has a very hotel-vibe with a terrace, bar, cafe. Totally worth the money. Would 100% recommend

It's best place to stay, the staffs are so friendly and welcoming. Also they kept my language in a locker even after my stay. I'd recommend this for any one. 

Something to improve:
Would be nice if there more showers and bathrooms

Location, location, location. This is the main asset of this nice hostel. The rooms are good, the staff is also nice and you feel safe to connect to other people there. A great bargain in beautiful and energetic Madrid. A safe bet for a budget place.
Clean, comfortable, nice staff. Don't forget to bring your padlock. The breakfast buffet is totally worth for 4.50 eur

adr_address: Calle Gran Vía, 72, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Gran Vía, 72, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Madrid Plaza España by Melia

reviews.text: Centrally located from Madrid it's not a bad place to stay but there are better places to stay.  Stafford Okay rooms were decent clean but small

Wish i could give a 0 star. I never gave a review ever but this is one filthy, dirty disgusting hotel that forced me to write one. Floor seems never mopped, full of hair everywhere, dirty bedsheets, pillow covers and towels. Bathroom sink platform stick from previous use i guess. Front desk people have mountain load of attitude and exteremly rude. And absolutely no amenities even though booked premier room. On top hotel charged me 66 euros per day for one child that shared the bed. Please never never stay here. Oh one more thing, when you enter the hotel, there are about 8 or so step and u need to carry your heavy luggage yourself. Even though you are stuggling, front desk folks who are watching you will not come for any help.

Filthy! Never again. Stayed here last week. The lobby seats were dirty and ripped. The seats in the room were dirty. Cabinet doors were worn and moldy as was the bathroom door. Mirrors beside the bed were both cracked. Paint marks on the skirting boards, on the ceiling..shabby. Small insects on the room floor. Floor not cleaned. Hotel has no bar. No restaurant. No cafe. There is a canteen open only for breakfast. Even the lift had a fault which was scary. Hotel is located on the Gran Via which is undergoing road works and will be for some time. So you look out at a construction site..horrible. Gran Via is also the least desirable location in Madrid..dirty with some shady characters about. You have to drag your suitcases up a stairway to get into the hotel. No ramp and no one to help. Dust everywhere. You can only turn off the air conditioning by flipping the trip switch in a fuse box that they leave open for you. This is a hazard especially with kids about. Can't understand why it considers itself a 4 star hotel.
Staff is really nice and rooms are fine

Absolutely perfect location. Right next to the metro and within walking distance of a wide variety of restaurants, bars, and attractions such as the Royal Palace. Rooms were larger than any of the other hotels we stayed in while traveling through Italy and Spain. Beds were also very comfortable.

adr_address: Paseo de la Castellana, 191, 28046 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Paseo de la Castellana, 191, 28046 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Exe Plaza

reviews.text: Clean and good place to stay. The buffet is very good and the place overall is great. Also there is a metro station right beside it so even though it isn't close to the center of the city, it is very easy to mobilize to it. Also there are many good restaurants around and it is a good area to walk and discover stores, markets and other places.
Comfortable hotel. Very good breakfast buffet. Good location close to several large company offices, train station, tube station and walking distance to football stadium.

Excellent hotel in a superb location!!
Our room had an enormous king sized bed, a sitting area & a big, flat screen TV. The bathroom was also lovely with lots of goodies. The hotel is opposite the metro station & a bus station. Friendly staff & had a Turkish baths too!
Love the big rooms. Intimacy. Fair prices if booked a little in advance.
Nice location. Near to nice restaurants and close to airport

adr_address: Calle de los Libreros, 7, 28004 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de los Libreros, 7, 28004 Madrid, Spain
name: Best Western Hotel Los Condes

reviews.text: It is a nice and cosy hotel right in the center of Madrid. Our room was small but very clean, the stuff was nice and friendly. Just the breakfast was very very simple and it was every day the same.
Amazing staff! And the locatio could not be better! Its price is totally worthy! Thanks gusya for making me feel like at home!!

Just booked in. Single Room a little on the small size but wonderfully located a stone's throw from the Gran Via. Didn't get to practice my woeful Spanish at the reception as spoke better English than I do.
Nice facility in the center of Madrid. Good value for money although the breakafast could do with some more imagination. Recommended.
very central within walking distance of gran via shops, restaurants and metro

adr_address: Plaza de Sta. Ana, 14, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza de Sta. Ana, 14, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: ME Madrid Reina Victoria

reviews.text: We booked there for 4 nights including breakfast.  When we first arrived, it is true that the staff greeted us and provided a good customer service.  We asked concierge to help to get some ticket to Royal Palace because I was told they can do that.  But then they said they cannot do on my behalf so I was misled what they could do.  About the restaurant, the girl host speaks English was fine but the waiter does not pick up any empty plates.  The restaurant is supposed to open at 7 a.m. on the weekdays and one time they did not even open their doors.  There were people waiting outside of the restaurant for good 20 minutes.  No one bothers to ask us and wondered why there was a line.  It turned out the girl host must be off and the waiter to keep the doors closed.  We just thought the restaurant was not open.  I just think there is room for improvement.  We had 2 beds and the room is very small but I do like the location is very convenient so that's why I gave a 4 stars.

The location was perfect. Everything was walking distance from the hotel. The room was great. The staff was extremely  helpful. Loved staying there. I’m planning to go to Madrid next year again and will definitely choose this same hotel.

The hotel is clean with a friendly staff. The rooms are small but well designed and modern to make use of the space. There's a nice terrace bar on the 7th floor. It's cool but in the weekends expect the loud music to travel to your room until 3 am. This is the reason why this hotel isn't getting a 5.

Great location and friendly staff. Our room with terrace was to our liking as well. Overall cleanliness of the rooms and hotel would benefit from 'spring cleaning'. Bed was comfy and minibar well stocked. However, our favourite part of the stay was breakfast - excellent and well balanced selection of goods.

The Sunday rooftop party was fun. 

Great DJs and cool vibe starting at 2pm until the late hours. Beautiful views and pretty people.

adr_address: Calle Arcipreste de Hita, n. 10, 28015 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Arcipreste de Hita, n. 10, 28015 Madrid, Spain
name: HOTEL EXE MONCLOA

reviews.text: Good quality for a decent price. Rooms are big and clean, great rooftop bar with a pool and stunning view, small gym in the basement. Edit after my second visit: unfortunately second time my room was way smaller and I was able to hear everything from my neighbour and footsteps from the hallway. And the wifi was just not working at all.
Beautiful place in a beautiful area! The room was clean and cozy. The personal was friendly. Metro station in front of the hotel entrance
Fantastic breakfast and staff but the room was a little noisy from the street and in need of some shape up. If you can get a room on the higher floors.
Love Madrid. Hotel opposite tram stop. Nice rooma
Very bad experience. Someone stoled my mother’s Iphone inside de hotel and non of the stuff helped to find it. They refused to show their security cameras to help us find the thief.

vicinity: Calle Arcipreste de Hita, n. 10, Madrid

adr_address: Calle Carmen 16, 2nd floor, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Carmen 16, 2nd floor, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Sungate One

reviews.text: Amazing hostel, amazing staff amazing location. Many additional things like meals, day excursions and night life. Great social area. A must of your travelling via Madrid! Also great value for money. I've stayed twice

Small scale hostile with friendly front desk. Shared facilities but never a wait. Rooms are clean and beds comfortable. Join for day outings as well as breakfast or dinner or do your own thing. I had a great time there.

Stay at this place if you love a laid-back, easy -to-socialize atmosphere. They're situated right in the center of everything, close to the metro, tacos, and to a great Flamenco place. Perfect for solo travelers.

It one of the best hostel that I have ever been, the reception was amazing ! And this hostel suggests an activities at the morning and at the night. You are not feeling alone at all and all the time meet new people. It’s really recommended for people who are traveling alone. At the morning/noon there is a possibility to do a tour and also to go to a tapas restaurant really cheap and at the evening there is a free dinner and afterwards a game drinks and then we are going to a bar and club together. I have only two problems, the noises from outside just disturb me to sleep and also I was the only girl in a mixed room. There were 3 boys and me. I couldn’t dress in my room and all the time have to go to the toilet to dress up. And it was a little bit awkward to go all the time with my pajamas to the toilet when I have to passed the reception and the dining room like this

Amazing hostel with great staff and location. Totally recommended. They bake many nice cakes and include everyone in their activities which is amazing for solo travellers as well. Great spirit. I was amazed by the staff and their hospitality. They would go the extra mile for you to get sure that you are feeling comfortable and enjoying and give lot of helpful tips

adr_address: Calle del Marqués de Urquijo, 4, 28008 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle del Marqués de Urquijo, 4, 28008 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel T3 Tirol

reviews.text: Room was comfortable and clean and the staff was friendly. My only complaint was that our room was way too warm and it was November. The only way to cool it off was to open the window and as the hotel is on a very busy avenue, it was quite noisy all night long practically. If you stay here and you want a good night's sleep, you would have to request an interior room.

For 3 srar hotel, it's difficult to say it's good.
Good: Very convenient area. Only 2 minutes walk from Metro. Plenty of hot water. Comfortable beds and room. Room always warm (January).
Bad: No refregiator. It will be terrible in summer. We left Coke and mineral water outside of the window but it can be dangerous for pedestrians.
No hot water pot, coffee and tea in the room. Doesn't look like 3 star hotel. No hot foods or salads (except tomato's) for breakfast.
Huge room great location

Everything was good; room was nice and clean and pretty spacious. Walls were a bit thin, by this I mean you could hear the cleaning of other rooms closeby. Only thing was that the pillows were a bit uncomfortable, they were long and circular in shape, different from the usual pillows. Apart from this things went smoothly and well. It is a bit of a walk away from the main center area but the metro is right across the street and easily accessible.
Large rooms, nice breakfast, great 8th floor terrace and friendly staff ... however, some general makeover needed in the next few years to keep up with todays standards

vicinity: Calle del Marqués de Urquijo, 4, Madrid

adr_address: Calle de José Abascal, 8, 28003 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de José Abascal, 8, 28003 Madrid, Spain
name: Tryp Madrid Chamberí

reviews.text: This hotel although a 3 star is a hidden gem, a good location and I did not have any issues with the room or the facilities. Second time I have stayed here and I will return:)
nice hotel. very clean.  good location.  staff pleasant.
Small but nice rooms. Breakfast could be better. Overall experience positive and price was reasonable.

Decent hotel but nothing more. Lobby is very small with no space to have meeting or works. Internet connection very slow. On the other side is clean enough. Probably good for an holiday I do not suggest for business....
Clean rooms!

adr_address: Calle de Antonio López, 65, 28019 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Antonio López, 65, 28019 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Praga

reviews.text: Not really impressed with the hotel facilities. Breakfast buffet could have been better. Comparing to equivalent star hotels, selection and quality of food is far inferior. I would not choose this again if I were to visit Barcelona again.
Great Hotel with amazing location. Really enjoyed the stay :)
It's ok, nothing great ,there are better options avay

The location was a bit out of the way from the main attractions in the city, but still was reachable by bus from the Atocha station. There was a supermarket and few restaurants in the area. The hotel was more frequented by tourist groups on their buses. 
The room was quite spacious and clean. The furniture and interior were a bit outdated though. The bathroom was spacious, although the cleanliness could be improved.
The lobby was packed with group tourists, and the slow elevators were cramped most of the times. 
Although the queues at the reception desk were quite long, the staff didn’t seem to care too much about guests’ inconvenience. They were slow, rude and busy talking to each other or on the phone even when there were long lines of guests waiting to check-in or check-out.

Centrally located. Very well connected with bus, metro and taxi services. 25 min by bus from Plaza Mayor bus 23, metro train 5
Breakfast - Good spread. Limited veg options
Small sized rooms. Only hair dryer available
No iron, coffee machine, water.. etc. 
Cafe + room service available below
Staff ok.

adr_address: Plaza de las Cortes, 7, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza de las Cortes, 7, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: The Westin Palace

reviews.text: I was placed on the 4th floor looking out to the street. They upgraded me to a king bed from a double twin. I did appreciate the upgrade. The room was pretty large, very clean, and quiet. It is also pretty close to the park, museum, and the plazas.

I visited the Westin Palace hotel in Madrid. The hotel is beautifully designed and centrally located. But I have to say the highlight of my trip was the Salon in the hotel. I had the pleasure of working with Rosa who was my beautician during my trip.  She did my make up and hair on various days and even for a special event. With everything she really listened to what I wanted and made me feel comfortable, beautiful and really tuned into my personal style. She made me feel like I was at home, even better than my at home Hair Stylist!

Large spacious bedrooms, variety of cuisines, nearby the city center and perfectly designed. I visited Westin Palace several years ago and I still remember every detail about it. They serve one of best homemade burgers in Madrid Also.

This hotel is in a great location. There are quite a few restaurants and shops near by. It’s not a far walk from the center of the city, too. The hotel was nice; however, some of the rooms need to be updated a little bit. A lot of the furniture and wall paper make it feel as if you are in your grandmother’s house. If you get a wake up call, the TV will turn on and serve as the wake up call.

Great and decent hotel... I extremely liked the fact that you can converse via the Marriott bonvoy app with the hotel. The hotel's location was also amazingly convenient to all the tourist site and it is at the same time close to some of the great restaurants that Madrid has to offer. I would definitely recommend this for you to stay in...

If the hotel is superb why not rate 5 stars? well, I was sneezing alot when I got to the room. I'm not sure what was triggering my allergies, could it be the curtains or carpet?...

adr_address: Calle de Agustín de Foxá, s/n, 28036 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Agustín de Foxá, s/n, 28036 Madrid, Spain
name: Weare Chamartín Hotel

reviews.text: Convenient location. Clean. Different types of rooms. Stayed there several times. Never had a problem. Friendly staff. Polite. Sometimes it takes a bit to get checked in.
Good hotel. Location is great if traveling on train. To and from airport is easy and only cost 2.60 euro. Easy access to metro for going in and out of city.

We missed our train and the people here were so nice to use. 
Very helpful and sweet. Stay here. it's good.

Everything is great except one thing - they cannot call you a taxi. You have to stand in a long long long queue at that train station for a taxi and this queue moves very slowly because of the shortage of taxis. Bear it in mind when you go to the airport. 🤬🤬🤬

Very convenient hotel. It is in the same building of  Chamartín. Hotel is comfortable and clean. If you like to take early train, it is the best choice. It has direct line to airport, also very convenient. You can find all the goods you need near by the station. Although the building and hotel is old, it has WiFi. WiFi speed is normal. I would said it is the best hotel for business trip. For family trip, it has three bad room. Breakfast is normal. But the location is too good to complain the other down side.

reviews.text: Nice and very clean hotel. Room was adequate. Breakfast was good. Friendly staff. Will stay again. Close to metro, dream fit gym and the plaza toro.

Typical ibis budget hotel - very small rooms but they have everything you need for a comfortable stay. Rooms are cleaned daily and staff are very accommodating. Make sure you choose a room which is not facing the street as those have windows which do not open.
Breakfast is nothing special but enough really.
The location is also great - there is a metro station nearby and it's only a 10-15 minutes trip from the center or most of the sights you might want to visit.

It's budget,  you get what you pay for. Staff friendly and helpful, rooms very average but clean. What I didn't like was the saloon door for the toilet so you you could hear what was going on, and the fact you couldn't have a private shower (it's clear glass and in the room). As a shared room it was uncomfortable, however if you're looking for a cheap stay, it's well located, beside a great metro line, and close to a lovely local bar for tostada and cafe in the morning but. don't expect the Radisson. It is what it says it is, a one star hotel and I would stay again.
Good place. Warm welcoming. English speaking staff and helpful.
Nice staff, very clean and comfortable, delicious breakfest. Excellent.

adr_address: Calle de Antonio Maura, 5, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Antonio Maura, 5, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Petit Palace Lealtad Plaza

reviews.text: I have never stayed in a Petit Palace before, and I have to say, they are really nice.  First, the desk staff were very nice.  It is always nice to greeted by a happy person after a day a travel.  We stayed in a room that only had window that looked into the interior.  At first I was kind of bummed, but it made for an extremely quiet room, which was very nice.  I would absolutely stay again.

This hotel has premium location: walking distance to pretty much all attractions in Madrid mentioned in tourist guides. Service is very friendly. Breakfast has more choices one can think of, including organic superfoods options. Many cafe and restaurants nearby. Rooftop view of Madrid in 6 minutes walk. Prado Museum 3 minuets walk. Bus tour of Madrid 3 minutes walk. Plaza de Major 15 minutes. Opera 20 minutes. High end shopping 10 minutes. Our room was clean, has sufficient space for all our belongings, table and chair for my laptop activities, roomy bathroom. Overall is excellent deal in the middle of Madrid. Highly recommend.

This is a great hotel in a fabulous area, very close to the Prado and Reina Sofia galleries.  Room was spacious, quiet and the shower in the bathroom is Amazing.  Staff helpful and nearby cafes good for breakfast.  Highly recommended

Loved the nice amenities and the delicious breakfast. The strollers that the hotel allows guests to borrow saved our trip, as one of our young sons was feeling a bit under the weather and didn't want to walk.... We put him on the stroller and walked all over Madrid without missing a beat!

Old meets new. 
Loved the way they preserved some of the old features, like the brick work, and mixed it with a very modern and stylish decor. The staff were brilliant. 

I was over for the marathon and the hotel was a 2 minute walk from the finish line. 

First choice hotel for my next visit. 😎

reviews.text: excellent boutique hotel. professional, caring and sincere service in a chic modern setting. everyone we met was dedicated to make sure our stay was the best it could be. nice room with great amenities. one of the best heavenly room slippers ever!

The bar at this hotel is a must visit! Spectacular and very original interior, which means that if you come alone, you'll have plenty of things to explore with your eyes. The menu is rich - good drinks and the food was delicious. Highly recommend the sepia fish balls (in pic). Above all, the staff was extremely good. Very friendly and funny, communicative, timely and overall efficient. When in Madrid, I will come back.

I’ve been to more than 30 countries worldwide. This hotel staff are the best, and they will assure you feel home. I’ve received the most gratitude and welcoming every time I get in/out of the hotel with a big smile. Definitely will come back here again if I visited Madrid.

We LOVED this hotel. The staff was so friendly. Housekeeping was great and the front desk was extremely helpful. I would highly recommend. The only downside - if you are looking for a fitness center, this one is lacking. It is a small room with two bikes and an elliptical. Would stay here again for sure.

Very pretty are art collections at the lobby and at the gallery's  downstairs. The hotel design is unique.
The Junior Suite Duplex room is very small and not fun to stay in
Both the superior room and the Junior Suite are very nice and fun
I think the hotel can close the pool with some cover and heat the pool which will make the roof very fun at the winter.
The stuff of the hotel was great! very kind and useful.

reviews.text:
The service at this hotel is exceptional, simply wonderful. All items and facilities concerning the rooms are of an extremely high standard - from the Clarins products, bathroom suites, extremely comfortable beds and bedding, as well as the standard of room cleanliness. Twice a day turn down service was also great. Amongst the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

Location is very central, and you can pretty much walk to all of the tourists attractions. A special mention to Lucas for his especially polite and attentive manner - especially when running into a downpour from the lobby to help us find a taxi.
They offer a free bar and tapas till 23hrs. Excellent service. Breakfast is overpriced so would not recommend taking it there.
We had a great stay at this hotel. Great location and exceptional service!
Really 5 star hotel with great employees, excellent service and good  food, drinks and everything.  Really enjoyed the experience.

Nice design, good quality. However, we have tried the Montmartre Restaurant where we have been terribly sick without receiving any support from the hotel directors. This is not at the level of such an hotel. Because we stayed two days in bed for this food poisoning, we would have expected the hotel directors to get somehow preoccupied. Nothing.

Very nice restaurant, great for lunch.

reviews.text: It is impossible for me to understand why this hotel has such a high rating as well as why it has 4 stars, when in reality it hardly qualifies for an old 2 star one. If this were a 2star hostel, it would be understandable. For 4 star Hotel this is unacceptable
Hotel was okay. Nice staff, nice room. Only wifi didn't work. Good price
The rooms are basic but clean and the staff very helpful and friendly as a tourist Hotel you could not ask for more

The staff are polite and careful. In fact, to me it is a 3-star hotel, I think that it's OK, but the guest should know in advance.
Not bad at all for the price but they had no wi-fi for two or of the the days that we were there.

formatted_address: Av. del Valle, 50, 28740 Rascafría, Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Rural Los Manzanos

reviews.text: Lugar muy agradable ideal para descansar un fin de semana. Lo que más nos gustó fue la atención de la dueña, muy amable y cercana. También hay que destacar el desayuno que es todo casero con tostadas, bizcocho casero y zumo recién exprimido. Como pega pondríamos las almohadas que eran un poco bajas y el precio un poco elevado pero en general un sitio para repetir sin duda.

Horroroso. Es con mucho el hotel donde peor me han tratado. El personal es totalmente desagradable. Atienden con desgana y desconfianza. Parece que te hacen un favor si vas a su hotel.Les molestan los niños pero no tienen inconveniente en cobrar por ellos y por el desayuno (6 euros por una taza de leche, en caso de mi hijo). El desayuno son unas tostadas  frías y un bizcocho. Las habitaciones dan a la carretera, aunque al reservar te digan que no te preocupes no se acuerdan ni del precio dado ni de este extremo. Si tienes niños te preguntaran la edad y les mirarán como bichos molestos.
Las habitaciones son nuevas pero el suelo es muy frío. No hay cama de matrimonio y no están unidas las dobles.

Jamás me había ocurrido: me he tenido que ir sin pasar la noche allí. Habitación 114, la luz de emergencia se encendía y apagaba constantemente, imposible dormir así. La señora de la casa me dio por respuesta "es que no tiene llave (interruptor)". Señora, se mira a ver si se puede solucionar: se saca la bombilla, se llama a alguien, se le cambia a uno de habitación y si está lleno pues se busca arreglo de alguna forma. Tal y como indican otras críticas, la calefacción apagada y sin posibilidad de ponerla en marcha. Una de las lámparas de la mesa de noche no funcionaba. En resumen: frío, oscuro y con una luz titilando toda la noche... me tuve que marchar. NO lo recomiendo en absoluto.
Menú turístico. Precio económico. Buena calidad , sin grandes pretensiones. El servicio muy bueno, camareros amables .

Deliciosa comida casera y ambiente tranquilo, agradable.  El lugar es especialmente bonito y la atención excelente. Como en casa.
En las paredes cuadros muy bonitos!!!!

reviews.text: Although we had a slight language barrier we still managed to get by okay. Our host was super friendly, our rooms were also clean and tidy.

Una posada muy acogedora, situada en un pueblo tranquilo,con bosques para poder pasear oyendo los cánticos de los pájaros, esta a unos 18 KLM de Segovia y cercano a otros pueblos de mucho interés.. La posada tiene un jardín muy bonito y esta decorada con un gusto estupendo y sorprende gratamente.. El personal muy servicial y agradable, dan unas cenas buenas en un comedor elegante y el desayuno está muy bien
.volveremos. 
Un sitio para desconectar..
Sitio ideal para relajarse, desconectar del mundo. Trato de 100. Repetiremos seguro.
Un fin de semana genial. Excelente trato. Repetiré

En el pueblo de Collado Hermoso (Segovia) podrás disfrutar de unos días de relax en esta posada situada a los pies del Parque Nacional de la Sierra de Guadarrama.
Paseos agradables dentro de un entorno privilegiado en el que podrás encontrar desde las ruinas un monasterio cisterciense del siglo XIII hasta antiguos molinos de grano hoy rehabilitados para uso como vivienda particular.
Corzos, jabalis, zorros, lobos, rapaces y una lista interminable de especies animales componen la fauna local.

La posada cuenta con habitaciones amplias, bien decoradas y acogedoras.
El trato es agradable y correcto.

vicinity: Camino de las Rozas, s/n, Collado Hermoso

Good, better if it was a bit more cheap

Solo tengo buena opinión de todo. Muy buena experiencia.

La Posada de Alameda está ubicado en un entorno idílico perfecto para desconectar... el río, las cigüeñas, las estrellas, el olor de la naturaleza. Las camas muy cómodas, el desayuno excelente y el trato de Esther no puede ser mejor. Volveremos seguro!

Excelente sitio camas muy cómodas. Personal muy amable, arriba hay terraza para pasar un rato y ver las vistas.

Nos hemos hospedado mi pareja y yo y hemos salido muy contentos. Para empezar muy buen servicio, en el que nos han resuelto todas nuestras dudas. La habitación, muy acogedora con todo lo necesario. Recomendable 100%

Decepcionante..No lo recomiendo en absoluto por las siguientes razones:
RESUMEN: atencion 1/10 , limpieza 5/10, cumple con las expectativas 1/10, tranquilidad 1/10 y vistas 1/10

-El hombre que nos atendió fue extremadamente borde y con una actitud súper cortante, por no decir que la vestimenta no era la correcta. No sabía ni dónde estaban las llaves y me dijo que si “su cuñada” nos dijo que hacer con el cupón (el que llevamos de la vida es bella). Desconocía hasta cuando debíamos entrar y salir
- En la propia recepción había lo que era aparentemente familiares como el que están en su casa (cosa que entendí más tarde ya que me percaté de que vivían allí por que las paredes son DE PAPEL y se oye ABSOLUTAMENTE TODO de todos lados) Incluso tenían un perro en la terraza(no muy aseada) que no hacía más que rascar la puerta y ladrar.
-La habitación no tiene NADA QUE VER con las fotografías, incluye un baño con una bañera minúscula.
-La cama es súper dura y las almohadas apenas tienen relleno.
-ventanas con vistas a un patio interior del cual también se escucha todo.

Escasa limpieza, paredes de papel, ducha enana, además se caía la barra de la cortinas, toallas lija, y como guinda a este pastel, en la página ponía hostal de 2 estrellas y es solo de una, sobre todo x esto me sentí engañada, x suerte no tuve que pagarlo, pero no merece los 55 euros que cuesta. Y no tengo más sitio para escribir...

No se merecen ni una estrella,  reservamos una habitación con 3 semanas de antelación para celebrar nuestro aniversario y cual es nuestra sorpresa cuando llegamos allí y nos dicen que no tenemos ninguna habitación reservada teniendo todos los correos como que si,  son unos impresentables y se merece que no vaya nadie jamás. Lamentable

reviews.text: I got the tour. A quiet and cozy place. Also uniquely beautiful.

Hemos estado este fin de semana mi pareja y yo con nuestro perrete, la casa es perfecta,  Juan Andrés y Marisa son encantadores, te aconsejan rutas....que ver ....y donde comer y han acertado en todo, sin duda repetiremos. Es un lugar perfecto para desconectar y disfrutar de la sierra.

Javier y Miriam

Pasamos el puente de Andalucía en estos apartamentos.
Puntos positivos... Hospitalidad de Juan Andrés tanto con nosotros como con nuestra perrita, además nos dio recomendaciones de lugares que visitar, restaurantes, rutas de senderismo etc, la ubicación puesto que el pueblo es super tranquilo, la limpieza del apartamento, la calefacciones y el detalle del desayuno.
Puntos negativos.. En mi opinión la poca luminosidad del apartamento ya que desde por la mañana había que estar con las luces encendidas porque no entra apenas luz por la ventana y el ruido de los otros huéspedes en concreto nuestros vecinos se ve que tenían que ser decoradores de interior o algo porque se pasaban TODO el día mueble parriba y pabajo y eso a las 12 y media de la noche como que no mola.

Estancia super agradable y la habitación Taurus que es donde pasamos mi pareja y yo super bonita no la faltaba ningún detalle. Con el desayuno son bastante generosos no tuvimos ninguna pega, si os gusta la naturaleza y queréis desconectar completamente es el sitio ideal no se escucha ningún ruido. Volveremos.
