name: La Luna Sonriente Del Cuarto Creciente

reviews.text: Reservé en el mes de junio, la atención recibida por Mila fue de 10. Recomendado totalmente. La casa increíble.

Fatal. 
La casa en sí está bien pero tuvimos problemas serios con la dueña.
De primeras, no nos quiso hacer contrato ni quiso formalizar el pago por una transferencia (Evidentemente, no nos pidio fianza). 
La cafetera tenia moho, la rejilla del horno estaba totalmente carbonizada, la vajilla tuvimos que fregarla nada mas llegar de lo sucia que estaba, la mitad de los enchufes de la cocina no funcionaban, saltaban los plomos cada 2x3 y la nevera de arriba no enfriaba. El wifi tampoco funcionaba ni la depuradora de la piscina tampoco. 
Al comunicarle a la dueña las carencias del alojamiento, no tuvo la poca vergüenza de reconocerlo o simplemente pedir perdón.
Es una pena que un alojamiento así trate a unos huéspedes de ésta manera. Tenemos claro que no volveremos.

Trato amable, urbanización de lujo con vigilancia, parcela grande, piscina cubierta (no habilitada en invierno :( ), admiten mascotas, vivienda antigua con muebles y decoración un poco viejas, camas supletorias de poca calidad.
Maravilloso lugar para perderse y estar en contacto con la naturaleza y con uno mismo.

Naturaleza y Descanso en una de las urbanizaciones más exclusivas de Madrid
Os presento a La Luna Sonriente del Cuarto Creciente, nuestra casa está ubicada entre espectaculares montañas, ardillas y una variedead de pajaros que no te dejará indiferente. Emplazada en una de las urbanizaciones más prestigiosas de Madrid, rodeada de naturaleza y en un enclave indescriptible.
Un lugar realmente exclusivo, 5.000 metros distribuidos entre casa y jardín qué ofrece la posibilidad de celebrar cócteles, comidas o cenas privadas y actividades al aire libre.
Un lugar pensado para desconectar y relajarse en un entorno sin igual. A tan sólo 20 minutos del centro de Madrid, con todos los servicios a menos de 5 minutos. 
Ven y descubre la experiencia de combinar tu agenda de trabajo con actividades al aire libre. Un placer recibiros y qué disfrutéis unos días de descanso!!!
Se trata de una casa con espectaculares vistas, con un jardín enclavado en la mejor zona de la sierra madrileña. Más de 5.000 metros de terreno al aire libre, en el que disfrutar del aire puro mientras realizas tus actividades deportivas preferidas o disfrutas con una estupenda barbacoa en un entorno sin igual junto a nuestra pisicina "La Pililla".

vicinity: Calle Arroyo del Osea, 216, Dominio de Fontenebro

adr_address: Calle Cañada, 5, 28411 Moralzarzal, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Cañada, 5, 28411 Moralzarzal, Madrid, Spain
name: Hospederia La Cañada

reviews.text: Its a nice place to be!
Una muy buena relación precio calidad servicio , familiar y cercano zona muy agradable
Spa demasiado sencillo. Habitaciones corrientes aunque limpias
Personal muy amable. Habitación muy confortable. Lugar ideal para pasar un fin de semana en la sierra de Guadarrama y alrededores. Lo recomendamos.
Buen hotel para alojarse con muy buen trató

adr_address: Calle del Buen Suceso, 16, 28737 Braojos, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle del Buen Suceso, 16, 28737 Braojos, Madrid, Spain
name: Las Encarnas, Alojamientos Rurales

reviews.text: Hemos pasado el fin de semana en el apartamento de las lindes, la casa muy cuidada y limpia pero el tema ruido horrible! En el apartamento de al lado no dejaban de escuchar rap, se les oía subir y bajar las escaleras como un elefante... Los dos días a las 9 ya estábamos despiertos y lo que queríamos era descansar..  el resto todo genial pero necesita mejor insonorización
Genial, sin duda vuelvo. Trato espectacular y los apartamentos muy bien equipados. El desayuno variado, la cama cómoda y el jacuzzi está de lujo.
Un sitio muy acogedor y bonito. El trato muy cercano y eficiente, te ayudan en todo lo que necesites. Muy recomendable.
Un lugar con gran encanto. Bien gestionado, limpio y acogedor. 100% recomendable.
Ubicación genial. Apartamento muy limpio, decorado con gusto, ideal para un fin de semana rural...

adr_address: Calle Don Florencio, 31, 28737 Braojos, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Don Florencio, 31, 28737 Braojos, Madrid, Spain
name: Casa Rural El Bulín de Braojos

reviews.text:
Estuvimos en Casa Marta y todo genial!!! Casa para 10 personas o alguna más. Admiten mascotas, hay cuna y bañera para los bebés (bajo petición). Casa muy completa con todo tipo de electrodomésticos grandes y pequeños, menaje, toallas... y muy bien decorada. Un gran patio con mesas y sillas y hasta seta de calor para esos días/noches fríos, con barbacoa de piedra y "sofás-tumbonas".
No se puede aparcar en la calle pero sí se puede muy cerca de la casa. Sin duda repetiría y la recomiendo al 100%.
Estuve con mi familia un fin de semana y es una casa muy bien cuidada, cómoda y con todos los detalles, quedamos encantados

Estuvimos en casa marta de braojos, una pasada de casa! Preciosisima tiene de todo! Hasta desayuno para todos!! Acogedora y decorada con gusto!! Para mi una dde las mejores que he estado! Sin duda repetiré,

Hemos pasado mi novio y yo un finde increible en casa Zorzal, la casa muy bonita decorada y con todo lo necesario, el pueblo muy chulo aunque no tiene tiendas ni nada, pero el paisaje y las rutas merecen la pena. Marta un encanto. Mil gracias por todo, volveremos!!!
Totalmente recomendable para alojarse en braojos

adr_address: Calle de la Luna, 39, 28196 Paredes de Buitrago, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Luna, 39, 28196 Paredes de Buitrago, Madrid, Spain
name: Casas Rurales El Bulin de Paredes

reviews.text: Un lugar excepcional para descansar.
Lugar muy tranquilo. Buenas vistas. Perfecto si quieres desconectar.
Lugar tranquilo, ideal para ir con la familia a desconectar UN PAR DE DIAS(soy de ciudad y enseguida se echa de menos ver algo de jaleo) Muy recomendable
Cómoda y completa
Pasamos un fin de semana esplendido, la casa está genial, es muy grande y el pueblo muy tranquilo. La caldera no funcionó el segundo día y la leña estaba un poco verde

vicinity: Calle de la Luna, 39, Paredes de Buitrago

adr_address: Calle de los Llanos, 12, 28737 Piñuécar, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de los Llanos, 12, 28737 Piñuécar, Madrid, Spain
name: Casas Rurales El Bulín de Piñuecar

reviews.text:
Lugar tranquilo y relajante. Casa confortable, con chimenea y calefacción controlada por sistema netatmo (muy interesante).

Cuentan con Netflix y WIFI.
Casas rurales totalmente equipada para una estancia agradable y única en un entorno mágico

adr_address: Av. del Valle, 39, 28740 Rascafría, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Av. del Valle, 39, 28740 Rascafría, Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Rural El Valle

reviews.text: This place is good for a weekend break in the mountains. It's not located in the village centre, but within easy walking distance of everything. The rooms are small, cosy and clean.
Relax total
Hemos pasado un fin de Semana estupendo, el hotel está impecable, muy limpio y el personal es de lo más agradable. Recomendable totalmente!!

Muy acogedor, la decoración rústica hace que sea cálido y familiar. Habitación bien equipada, la nuestra tenía una terraza enorme con vistas a la montaña. 
Buena relación calidad-precio. Volveremos! 😊😉
Muy cerca de Madrid. Ideal para hacer senderismo y aventura.

adr_address: Calle Alcalde Pedro Martín Martín, s/n, 28739 Gargantilla del Lozoya, Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Alcalde Pedro Martín Martín, s/n, 28739 Gargantilla del Lozoya, Madrid, Spain
name: El Encanto del Valle del Lozoya

reviews.text:
La casa es acogedora y limpia, con todo lo necesario para pasar unos días desconectando. 
Tiene una piscina climatizada de agua salada, y una experiencia para los peques de Sirenas y Tritones que disfrutaron muchísimo.

Acabamos de venir de pasar unos días y nos ha parecido una maravilla, tanto el trato de Miriam (recepcionista) como la casa con todo tipo de detalles, sin duda volveremos a repetir. La experiencia con lo de las sirenas fue genial y sobre todo el detallazo que tuvieron con nosotros. Una y mil veces muchas gracias. Estamos deseando volver a ir. 
Un saludo
Elena

Un sitio perfecto para descansar, a una hora de Madrid, muy tranquilo, las casitas limpias y con todo lo que necesitas, enseres de casa, toallas, cafetera, tostadora no le falta un detalle, una piscina cubierta calentita.
Esta en un pueblo pequeño rodeado de montañas y cerca de Rascafria o Navacerrada.
Lo recomiendo para pasar un fin de semana tranquilo en Familia o en pareja.
El personal muy amable y atento a todo lo que necesites.
Seguro que volveremos.

Complejo de casas muy confortable. Atención cordial. A destacar piscina cubierta muy agradable y climatización inmejorable.  Actividad acuática "sirenas y tritones" que encanta a los niños. Muy recomendable
Fantástico sitio para descansar y relajarse...piscina climatizada espectacular

vicinity: Calle Alcalde Pedro Martín Martín, s/n, Gargantilla del Lozoya

adr_address: Calle de Preciados, 37, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Preciados, 37, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Preciados

reviews.text: This hotel is spotless and great service and all their interiors and facilities are modern and up to date. They are also located in a very central part of the city. We absolutely loved our stay.
The hotel is very excellent and fairly new. Plus the breakfast was varied and delicious .. The hotel has a privileged location and close to all tourist attractions. I strongly recommend it ..

Preciados enjoys the perfect location from which to walk to all the major attractions in the city. It's a great hotel. The rooms are clean, spacious, extremely quiet. Large breakfast buffet with freshly cooked Spanish delicacies. Helpful reception staff.

Fabulous stay, the hotel and ALL the staff are so accommodating and friendly. Parking was included in our offer and you drive right up to the front door, they then park it for you in there underground car park. The room was very comfortable with a free minbar and safe. We had a fabulous meal in the restaurant and all the staff were very attentive and helpful ‘Cafe Varela’. We would highly recommend.

The position is perfect, in the center of Madrid;  the rooms are very confortable and sound-proof and we slept extremely well. We want to stress how nice, polite and helpful the staff was: everyone always ready to give the right advice (if asked) and make our experience in Madrid much better. The breakfast is wonderful, with a large selection of beverages, food and desserts. I reccomend the raw ham with olive oil!

adr_address: Calle Biarritz, 2, 28028 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Biarritz, 2, 28028 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel NH Madrid Ventas

reviews.text:
Great value for money. Rooms are clean and service is very good! Friendly personnel as well. Bathroom is spacious and clean, water of shower tends to shift between temperatures though but otherwise very good hotel! 

Hotel is located near the bullring in an area of the working class. Very nice location!

This Hotel is like every other hotel in all aspects; but the real test comes when that one of difficult situation arises and this is where this Hotel STANDS OUT from every other Hotel.
Unfortunately I was the difficult situation where I fell ill on my first day of my vacation here. This is when the real character of the hotel appears. The way they looked after me was mind blowing. They personally took me to the medical center, stayed with me for God knows how many hours; then when I had to be shifted to the Hospital for further treatment, they still kept in touch checking on me. Looked after my important documents that I had left out as I needed to be rushed urgently and also helped me with accommodations at a reasonable rate because of my unplanned extension of stay! All in all very impressive.
A big shout out to Luis at the front desk; Emanuel and all the staff there!! Madrid sightseeing is remaining for me; and when I come back; I will make sure to stay here!!!

Sm;)es
Dr. Kayannush Dadachanji

Good location in Ventas central Madrid next to the architecturally incredible bull ring. Welcoming and helpful staff. I stayed in a standard room which was a touch small but that aside the hotel was clean the bed very comfy, great bathroom and spacious shower unit.
Woderful service and delicious meals. Quite good localization. Only few minutes to metro station.

Beautiful, modern and clean hotel in a working class neighborhood of Madrid. About a 5 minute walk to the Ventas Plaza de Toros and its Metro Stations.  About 4 metro stops from Plaza Mayor a 10 minute commute. This is an authentic Madrileño neighborhood. Very few tourists and lots of locals. Lots of food options and shopping.

adr_address: Av. de Logroño, 305, 28042 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Av. de Logroño, 305, 28042 Madrid, Spain
name: Meliá Barajas

reviews.text: Second time staying here and even lovelier than I remember it. Great amenities, friendly staff, great beer, fantastic breakfast buffet (I'm sure they make their scrambled eggs with cream- a must try!). Room stunning and very large, bathroom fit for a king. Plenty of great restaurants and bars within walking distance. McDonalds just to the right as you exit the hotel, and to the left a 5 minute walk to the subway station. Beautiful!!

Iberia overbooked my buisness flight and lost my suitcase so I had a not planned one night stop in this hotel... Room is really beautiful and big for a 4 stars Hotel and everything is inside what you need. It is clean and the stuff were always kind. Breakfast was good... I can highly recommend this hotel...
It's always a safe shot here near the airport, it's been many times now and never disappointed, good bang for the buck 👍
Good value for money, restaurant is op till 0:30. Large room, good bed, close to the airport. Very nice breakfast buffet

Good airport.hotel with an amazing buffet breakfast. The rooms were pleasant and spacious, but it would have been nice to have additional power beside the bed so I didn't have to unplug the lamp. The bed was comfortable although two singles fixed together. The bathroom had separate tub and shower. The breakfast buffet was completely amazing. One of the best I have ever seen. We saw a rainbow end to end outside, which was nice, as we found the windows would open for fresh air. Shuttle to the airport was efficient and easy. To pick up from the airport to the hotel was also easy. Just go to the hotel bus section and wait, or phone them to make sure they have someone on the round. Yes it does stop at all the terminals, but it is free.

adr_address: Calle de Hermosilla, 2, 28001 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Hermosilla, 2, 28001 Madrid, Spain
name: Gran Meliá Fénix

reviews.text:
Not comfortable as it should be. Small unergonomic bathroom. Pour ventilation.
Nice entrance hall and lobby. Outstanding breakfast menu and seating. Good location for city tourists.

Hotels like this will always have a client base willing to pay, who like the elegance and charm of a classic style hotel. However I believe the quality of 4 star hotels to be on a par with this, and in some cases better in terms of comfort and amenities. The room felt tired and was not clean in the corners of the carpet, the bathroom was not practical and too small, I actually hurt myself in the bathroom because of how awkward it was. I would not choose to stay here again until it is refurbished. The Aduana restaurant in the rooftop was very nice and service from all the staff I encountered was excellent.
Best hotel experience in my life. There are not enough compliments for my experience so far. 2 days left to go.

Not a five star hotel !! Maybe three. Service needs huge improvement !!! We came as a family and booked  3 rooms I requested to be on one floor hotel was not sold out we had three rooms on different floors , because we were not  considered  regulars there as per front desk words.  Three hours to check and at night if you like Loud party music until 4 am.  And check out you do it your self!!   staff does not care.  They had a marathon that day as always on Sunday we had to walk blocks to get taxi staff could not care. Elsa manager did not help at all at check and no return call.  Like a small hotel style. Go to another hotel. Tons in Madrid.
One of my favorite in Madrid. Next to Columbus square above the Hard Rock restaurant right in front of Castellana avenue.

adr_address: Calle de la Victoria, 2, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de la Victoria, 2, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: I Love Madrid Hostel

reviews.text:
The only good thing about this hostel is the great location right in the city centre. But next to that the second worst hostel experience of my life! 

The rooms are really noisy cause the walls are like paper and the windows towards street full of pubs and clubs don't help at all. So bring earplugs! But even with them it's hard to sleep cause the bunk beds are old, noisy, saggy and really shaky so that you feel every movement of the person above you. 

The washrooms are old and most of the stuff ist broken or close to that. The ceiling in the showers is full of mold and the doors are completely see through. Next to that there's no possibility to put your things while you're showing in cold or hot water (you can't influence it). Only good thing: it's pretty clean.

The people from the hostel only speak a little English and they are turning off every single light in the washrooms after a minute or so even when your still in it. 

So I definitely do NOT recommend this hostel at all! 

(And if someone of the hostel stuff wants to comment on this post, saying I was never a guest of them - I still got my receipt and I could post pictures of the hostel)
Recommended hostel. Very safe and good attitudes of employees. Excellent location in the middle of everything.

I give a rating of two because the location was good. Close to metro and monuments. Unfortunately, the windows overlook the party street and the room was very noisy all night. 
On the minus side: 
The electrical contacts at the beds were destroyed, 
the water in the shower was cold, 
The wifi was very slow, 
no promised snack machine, 
Leaving luggage after check-out costs 5 euros per day. 

Considering the number of different hostels in the vicinity of this hostel I do not recommend

Pretty standard hostel in a very central location. I only stayed 1 night.  Got placed in a convenient room after arriving late at night.  The party outside in the street gores all night and is quite loud. I can sleep through it buy might be an issue for lite sleepers.
Definitely the worst experience in a hostel ever! I wouldn't recommend it at all! Soooo freaking noisy, the beds are squeaky, no hot water, wifi so unstable....

adr_address: Calle Laguna Dalga, 4, 28021 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Laguna Dalga, 4, 28021 Madrid, Spain
name: Vértice Roomspace Madrid

reviews.text: Not the greatest location. Staff was rude. I asked to borrow a pair of scissors to cut something and they told me that I would have to leave a deposit if I wanted to use the scissors. The rooms were basic, but nice.

- The booked double bed consisted of two pushed together single beds, which were also wobbly and constantly moved

- The furniture was old and worn. The shelf is almost falling apart and the kitchen is also scrap.

- Breakfast is available in the cafeteria next door, but it was so crowded and loud that we decided to have breakfast in the center of Madrid.

+ The Room was big and cleaned every day.
+ WLAN 

In summary, for one night its "okay" but for longer trips I would definitely choose another hotel.
It ain't bad. A bit far to reach but was alright in general.

Air conficonditi is very bad we had to change rooms and Wifi is terrible very slow and very bad breakfast is only bread and tea I really do not recommend this hotel it's very bad. I did not enjoyy stay at all

Lovely hotel and perfect for our needs, as we were going to download festival which was a short taxi journey away. There's free parking just outside the hotel and the rooms were very clean and great air conditioning. The restaurant on-site  was pretty basic and not great but cheap and cheerful.

adr_address: Plaza del Emperador Carlos V, 8, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza del Emperador Carlos V, 8, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Mediodía Hotel

reviews.text: Right out side the main train station in Madrid very convenient when you have been stranded due to Iberia golng on strike, it is a no frills hotel but very comfortable all the same

Room was clean but requires double pane, too noisy day especially at night when one needs to sleep. Staff was so VERY RUDE and unhelpful to a family of 4 with kids on a rainy Mar 6, 2019. Quadroom price was almost 200 euros which would have been worth it if the staff were decent. The woman  and elderly guy at the front desk VERY BADLY need retraining as they don't have  any iota of customer care which is bad for the company image.
A comfortable room very helpful and friendly staff. Convenient to the train station.

Amazing location. No need for taxi - just 10 minutes walk from railway station (just love the Spanish rail system)
Small rooms yet spotlessly clean. Rather pricey but would come to this hotel again.
Close to art museum and bars and bus stops and theatre.
Great location. Sofia museum and Atoche right nearby. Nice and helpful staff. My room overlooked the Sofia plaza!

vicinity: Plaza del Emperador Carlos V, 8, Madrid

address_components.long_name: Calle de Ventura de la Vega
address_components.short_name: Calle de Ventura de la Vega

adr_address: Calle de Ventura de la Vega, 5, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Ventura de la Vega, 5, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: Room007 Ventura Hostel

reviews.text: Good place to stay and relax. But it does not have a common room to meet and chill with other people at hostel

Fantastic location! Cheap breakfast with coffee and pastries, employees spoke English very well, decent size room (had 2 bed private room w/ private bath). Only downside was having to press a button every 30 seconds to keep the shower on.

For private room - clean room, nice staff. Very close to Puerta del Sol. It seems that in the rooms next to ours, there was a group of teens and we barely hear some noise, I could hear only the closing doors of the nearby rooms. In the restaurant are going to tell that you can not pay with card for less than 10 eur.
Location wise is great!! Next to main sightseeing spots, bars and restaurants. A great neighborhood. They don't have a common area, so don't expect to cook or have a few drinks before going out.
A hostel like how a hostel should be. Expecially the price rate was very fair, not too much for what you get. Very nice staff, lovely rooftop area. Very well located. I would go back here!

vicinity: Calle de Ventura de la Vega, 5, Madrid

adr_address: Calle de Goya, 79, 28001 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Goya, 79, 28001 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Vincci Soma

reviews.text:
Clean, well designed rooms. Relatively large room size for the city. Excellent location (center of Barrio Salamanca). Price was reasonable when I stayed. They have a nice little library room and a decent hotel gym (for the area) if you have some time to kill at the hotel - though it's better to spend that time enjoying the surrounding area.

In summary, a solid 4-star hotel choice.
Good location, close to metro Goya, groceries and shopping. Walls thin and tastefully furnished with IKEA products.  Very small gym.  Some parts under renovation.  Comfortable library.
Nice enough, but very thin walls so a lot of noise transmission. Good location and nice breakfasts
Basic white rooms. It looks like a student campus. Breakfast is however fantastic and staff are extremely helpful.
Hotel close to metro Goya, staff not too helpful with directions. The breakfast was okay but do not recommend for the price (40 Euros for two people). Stop in a local breakfast restaurant.

adr_address: Calle de Emilio Vargas, 3-5, 28043 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Emilio Vargas, 3-5, 28043 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel ILUNION Atrium

reviews.text:
The plus of the hotel is definitely its proximity to our offices - barely 2 minutes walk. It is also quite close to the airport which makes it a good place to stay for work. The bed and pillows are comfortable, the bedrooms are moderne. The bathroom is nicely designed and cleaned. Room service is available which is perfect for late arrival.
On the less positive side, the restaurant is not the not the best in terms of choice and quality. 
Should you come to visit Madrid, the hotel is then too far from the center and the area around is not dynamic.
Rooms are nice but facilities are quite poor and location is detached from the center
The rooms are nice, but they no longer let you borrow an iron, and they charge 7€!! to iron a single shirt.
This is the go to place when staying in Madrid, price quality ratio is excellent
Great hotel, nice staff, breakfast could include some veggies... No indoor pool

adr_address: Calle del Prado, 18, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle del Prado, 18, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: Vincci Soho Hotel

reviews.text: Nice modern and cosy room. Plenty of space. Staff was helpful and friendly. Nice buffet and lunch/dinner options. General atmosphere and decoration was quite nice. I will definitely come back

I liked this hotel. It has cute and unique decorations at the lobby and even in a room. Very clean and modern. Moreover the people were so kind and helpful. Showed us various type of rooms to chose and explained everything we need ! Like like. I will definitely come again!

In general quite a nice hotel with perfect location. The staff is very friendly and helpful, breakfast is delicious (if they also had some dark bread would have been lovely☺️). My slight disappointment was with the rooms as they are quite small. I initially had a double room which could fit only the bed and no much space apart from that. The rooms are quite dark as the design is in dark and black nuances - not quite suitable if one has to work in the evening in case of a business trip.

Very nice hotel, excellent location, well designed and an amazing breakfast buffet. 
Be careful when they allocate you a room at check in, mine turned out to be noisy during the night being next to the stairs, and was almost blind with only a hidden tiny window overseeing a dark court helped with artificial light.

Great hotel in the middle of Madrid. He location is simply amazing: near the bus stops and metro, a carrefour express at a minute walk and very comfortable. The beds are great and the bathroom is very nice. The internet connection is quite fast and great to work.

adr_address: Calle del Dr Cortezo, 10, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle del Dr Cortezo, 10, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Eurostars Plaza Mayor

reviews.text: Nice hotel with cozy rooms and roof restaurant in "A" building. Great location for tourists, both city centre and metro stop are really close. I liked the breakfast and had a good sleep after a long while.
Good place. Very centric.
Very comfortable. Enormous bed. WiFi a bit iffy. Great location. Breakfast seems very expensive. Cafe across the road does croissant and coffee for less than 3 euros.
Nice hotel, fair price. Breakfast is recommended to take.

adr_address: Calle de Atocha, 45, 28012 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Atocha, 45, 28012 Madrid, Spain
name: FAR HOME ATOCHA

reviews.text: Clean, modern and nicr staffs. Lounge was good too
Decent clean rooms. Fine beds. Washrooms are a bit nasty.
Okay bed, clean towels, fast check in/out. Toilets are smelly and not that clean. There was a lot of noise in our room from staff, washingmachine next door and som kind of ventilator.

The rooms are crowded and there's little privacy, but you know what you're getting when you book a room that fits 8 people. Otherwise, rooms, sheets and bathrooms are very clean, everything well maintained. Breakfast is great, staff is helpful and the decor is great. Location-wise it is fantastic, in a major street a minute from a metro station and walking distance from many attractions.

Probably the best hostel I've stayed at. I spent a full week there and everything apart from a couple of inconsiderate roommates was great. The staff was friendly, the rooms and common spaces were clean and cosy, and the location was amazing!

adr_address: Calle Marqués de Zurgena, 4, 28001 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Marqués de Zurgena, 4, 28001 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel NH Collection Madrid Colón

reviews.text:
I loved the size and location of the room. Right smacked in the heart of the shopping district of Colon and Goya, find all your high street fashion brands and even the only department store of Spain just within walking distance. 

Though a single room, it can even fit up to two people comfortably. I liked that the room separates itself from the “hallway” and bath room. Natural light spills into the room, the shower and bathroom is large and comfortable, most importantly very well lit. 

Service was great and price was reasonable considering it to be at the heart of the city. 

15 - 20 mins walk to major sights like Prado museum, Atocha station, Gran Via, Sol 

Hotel also in close proximity to stations on Line 4, Colon and Serrano 

Also just about 15 mins by Uber to the airport (20euros) or just a short walk to the airport train at Recoletos station. To note that there are stairs leading down to the tracks so don’t recommend it if you have large luggages.
I loved the hotel. Amazing breakfast, small rooms for the price but high-quality features and amenities. Also, the staff was very nice and attentive. Will definitely go back.
Very nice hotel, great location good food and good service
Good location, close to metro. Excellent breakfast, with plenty of fresh fruit and pastries. Single rooms are rather small, but still comfortable.

Despite the back alley like approach this hotel is not to be considered on first appearance. It is smart spotlessly clean and the staff are very helpful.
The website pictures of the rooms and other facilities are truthful. We had a comfortable stay.
Although the breakfasts is expensive it caters for all. The dinner menu is limited but the quality is excellent.
If you feel a bit more adventurous this hotel is located in the right place to sample a wide range of cuisine and entertainment.
If you are energetic the main tourist attractions are walkable from the door or from our experience, a pretty cheap taxi ride.

adr_address: Calle de Trafalgar, 35, 28010 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Trafalgar, 35, 28010 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Trafalgar

reviews.text: Staff is nice and polite. You can hear everything that is happening in the rooms next to yours. Breakfast is not great, lack of choice of foods. Overall it's an OK hotel with a nice location.
Very small rooms, narrow elevator.  Staff can be nicer
Simply good, location is good the rest is ok, but the bathtub during winter times is always a +

Stayed one night at this hell hole, never again, can hear everything in the next room, rooms are totally 1960's the hotel is in serious need of modernization. Room was large but that's about it. Bed was like sleeping on the floor, hard as a rock. Breakfast Omg I don't think you can call. It breakfast, staff are rude. I would never recommend this place to anyone, complete waste of money. Please don't even consider this as an option you will regret it.

Rooms were extra small. Hotel was tidy.
I was extremely disappointed that the front desk person would not let me get an apple at 6:57am because the “breakfast isn’t open until 7am “ and my cab was waiting 
I was quite offended

adr_address: Calle Entre Arroyos, 19 Bis, 28030 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle Entre Arroyos, 19 Bis, 28030 Madrid, Spain
name: Scout Madrid Hostel

reviews.text: I've never stayed in a hostel, but Scout Madrid Hostel had everything we needed for our stay. We stayed in the 12 dorm mix, all linen included, comfy beds and pillows, shower per each room and toilet, and breakfast included. Towel rental was a generous size and good quality. Breakfast was simple and fulfilling. The service was great and the place was clean. I highly recommend Scout.

Thank you very much for your hospitality! I was more then happy when I enter this warm place and met great people. Also was a great place to stay with my wheelchair because of all the facilities what are made for disabled people.
Very kind staff. Good breakfast. Clean and quiet. Nice backyard, to sit and enjoy. You are in the center of Madrid in 15-20 min. Very recomended!
Really Nice but the beds Are hard

Very nice place, very helpful staff, super clean, close to the metro station (about 7 minutes of walking). Very big drawer for each bed (it contained my big bag very comfortably, but don't forget to have your lock).

adr_address: 1°Dcha, Calle de Bailén, 39, 28005 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: 1°Dcha, Calle de Bailén, 39, 28005 Madrid, Spain
name: Abracadabra Suites

reviews.text: Nice and helpful staff. Very close to sightseeing, bars and restaurants. New and beautiful room. Very clean. Attention: reception closes at 18 h.

We stayed there for 3 nights, for the price it is a good deal. We were on the floor where bathrooms were shared and in the corridor, but the place felt empty and with not many people at least when we were there. The room was clean and cosy, in the hallway there was a mini shared fridge and microwave. The location is excellent for the price you are paying.

Great hotel! 
Really good location:
5 minutes walk to the Royal Palace, Mercado de San Miguel, Calle Mayor.
10 minutes walk to Sol, Gran Vía, Plaza Mayor.

Room was comfortable, clean and modern.  There's an electric kettle, iron and TV with USB and HDMI connection. AC/Heat worked amazingly.  Down the hall there's a microwave and a mini fridge. 
WiFi worked great. 

Bathroom was spacious. Shower looked brand new. Water pressure/temperature was correct. They offer toiletries. 

Staff was friendly and helpful. Be aware if you arrive after 6 PM (18:00), front desk is in a different location. There's a sign at the front door indicating it though, plus contact numbers and email address.

Good price, 42€/night.

Only bad thing was the bright green emergency light by the door that wouldn't turn off at night.

The room is simple but clean and comfortable. Beware though that this is a Hostel! We could barely sleep with all the drunkards talking and laughing out loud in the hallways. There were also construction works going on in the building and they started drilling at 9am (checkout is until 11am). There is no one taking care of the place after 6pm if you need anything. If you check in after 6pm you have to get the keys from an office that belongs to another company and which is a 15min walk away. They won't provide any info or handle complaints there, exchange keys for signatures.
checkin is not at the same place, if you arrive lately. then you need to walk 20mins or take a bus/taxi

adr_address: Plaza Cánovas del Castillo, 4, 28014 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Plaza Cánovas del Castillo, 4, 28014 Madrid, Spain
name: NH Collection Madrid Paseo del Prado

html_attributions: Hotel NH Collection Madrid Paseo del Prado
Hotel NH Collection Madrid Paseo del Prado
Hotel NH Collection Madrid Paseo del Prado

reviews.text: The perfect location next to all the attractions and restaurants without the noise. The rooms are clean and modern. The rooms are also much bigger than the ME Reina that I stayed at the remaining of my trip. This is a good home base to do your exploration. It's quiet, except for the internal noise of neighbors... The walls are thin. Breakfast is good though - those are the pictures I'm posting.
Very friendly and helpful hotel personnel. Excellent location! Really enjoyed our stay!

The worst “5-stars” hotel I’ve ever stayed! There is a 1-cm gap between the entrance door and the floor. Receptionist was not friendly, moreover seemed to be angry (maybe because he has to work in the worst 5-star hotel ever 🤷‍♂️).

Great location. So central you can walk nearly everywhere and if you feel tired after all the stuff Madrid has to offer, it's location it's perfect for a power nap.
Great staff, you feel so welcome the moment you step on the hotel,  it's like a big family always ready to attend your needs. The room was awesome, superb bed, extra comfy pillows, hot tub, ...and I can go on and on.
Breakfast was a delight, there's a buffet but you can still have eggs cooked to perfection (or to your taste) at the moment.
And if exercise is your thing, Gym has got amazing views since it's located on the top floor.
Definitely I would recommend it.
Terrific location, very comfortable, helpful staff, super breakfast!

formatted_address: Calle de Cartagena, 83, 85, 28028 Madrid, Spain

AC Hotel by Marriott Avenida de America
AC Hotel by Marriott Avenida de America
AC Hotel by Marriott Avenida de America

reviews.text: Nice staff, clean room. Meals in hotel appeared to be very overpriced. Close to metro but far from touristy places.

Very clean, friendly helpful staff, good sized rooms with good water pressure in the shower. The WiFi is strong. I had no issue streaming Netflix. The breakfast was a good selection of bread, meat, Spanish omlette, yogurt and fruit. I docked one star because their wasn't a coffee machine in the room.
Great hotel, friendly stuff. Clean and updated rooms.  4 star because very noisy, near busy street. I cound not get much sleep.  Besides great.

Update:
I would like to thank the hotel administration for their response and attention to detail. I look forward to enjoying the remaining part of my stay.

Old review:
1) Just like in any other service business, the first impression about hotel starts through the interaction with a receptionist. Unfortunately, this hotel does not seem to have realized importance of maintaining a professional receptionist team. Staff was not attentive and lacked in communication skills.
2) even though I arrived to this hotel at 6:40pm, my room was not ready and I had to wait. No refreshments or basic courtesies were provided in the meantime.
3) breakfast is another weakness of this hotel - choices are limited, I mean really limited. By 8:30am they stopped serving scrambled eggs.

Room service limited to specific days in a week and specific times. VERY noisy. Gym is a generous description of exercise facilities which is simply an old treadmill in a tiny room. They insist you pay the bill every time it hits €500... so since I was staying there for over a week I kept getting invoices under the door and demands to settle. Friendly staff are the only saving grace of the place.

adr_address: Calle de Mesonero Romanos, 14, 28013 Madrid, Spain
formatted_address: Calle de Mesonero Romanos, 14, 28013 Madrid, Spain
name: Hotel Avenida Gran Via

reviews.text: Tiny Room, just barely fits the bed, one side locker rammed up beside the wardrobe. Wardrobe has a sliding mirror door but needs a lot of energy to slide it across. Room air-conditioning is non existent, left window open to keep cool. Street noise at night is unbearable, glass recycling Lorry every few minutes. Floors creaked, corridor smelled old and neglected. All it has going for it is the location beside Gran Via, but worth staying else where!!!
Nice room very polite staff. Has got a caffee inside and you can have breakfast there.
Cheap and cheerful hotel, needs a bit of tlc but for the money it's perfect, hard beds but not a problem and the location can't be beaten, middle of madrid and can walk either way to see loads
Good customer service and wonderful location
basic passing by kind of hotel. clean and good location. 5 min walk from Sol station
